content.biography:
Jobst Vascular Institute is a world-renowned vascular center that provides patients access to comprehensive vascular services including: vascular testing, vascular rehabilitation, wound care, anticoagulation care, clinical trials, and specialized treatment for varicose and spider veins.

The physicians of ProMedica Physicians Jobst Vascular and Jobst Vascular Institute all are board certified in vascular disease. With 15 office locations across northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan, we are committed to providing our patients and their families with high quality, innovative, and patient-centered care.

Jihad T. Abbas, MD, is a board certified general & vascular surgeon with ProMedica Physicians Jobst Vascular, and a Clinical Associate Professor of Surgery at The University of Toledo Department of Surgery. Dr. Abbas has a special interest in aortic diseases, carotid diseases, and wound care and limb salvage.

Dr. Abbas and his wife, Kimberly, have three sons. Dr. Abbas is a graduate of The American University of Beirut, and is fluent in English, as well as, Arabic and French. He has been practicing vascular surgery in Toledo for more than 15 years. In their spare time, both Dr. and Mrs. Abbas are involved in community service and enjoy traveling abroad. He has been on the faculty at the University of Toledo for the last 18 years of his professional life.

content.name: Shaheen Alam MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationAddress:
5800 Monroe St.

content.biography:
Shaheen Alam, MD is a licensed psychiatrist. Dr. Alam is fellowship-trained in Child and Adolescent Psychiatry from the Brookdale University Hospital Medical Center in New York and received her doctorate from Tohoku University School of Medicine in Sendai, Japan.

She has had numerous articles and abstracts published in peer reviewed journals in addition to making many scientific psychiatric presentations.

Care Philosophy: Dr. Alam emphasizes the successful doctor-patient relationship, which is critical in mental health management. She also loves working in a multicultural environment, solving problems and facing challenges together with her patients.

Patients and Conditions treated: In addition to treating adults, families and individuals, Dr. Alam specializes in treating children and adolescents.

Some of the conditions she treats are: depression, anxiety, psychosis, bipolar, employee mental health, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).

More about me: Dr. Alam enjoys spending time with her family and practicing dance. She was the National Folk Dance Champion in Bangladesh three times.

content.biography:
Jatin Amin, MD, FACC is a cardiologist. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Dr. Amin is board-certified in cardiology, interventional cardiology, and internal medicine. 

Care philosophy: He believes in providing the most compassionate care available. Care that is personalized, patient-centered and comprehensive. 

Conditions treated: Coronary artery disease (blockages in circulation), cardiomyopathy (heart failure, weak heart), hypertension (high blood pressure), arrhythmia (irregular heartbeat), and valvular heart disease.

Procedures/treatments performed: Stress tests (exercise, nuclear), echocardiogram (ultrasound including TTE, TEE, stress echo), cardiac catheterization (diagnostic and interventional), interventional procedure (PCI, balloon angioplasty, stent implantation), and emergency procedures (STEMI, atherectomy, Intra-aortic balloon pump, temporary pacemaker).

title: Nancy Arquette MD - Obstetrics - Sylvania, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Nancy Arquette MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Nancy Arquette, MD, specializes in obstetrics/gynecology. Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born.

Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.

Dr. Arquette was born and raised in Toledo. Her care philosophy includes taking the time the patient needs to discuss, examine and treat their issues. Her care includes an emphasis on healthy eating and daily physical exercise.

primaryLocation.locationAddress:
605 Third Ave.
Suite D

content.biography:
Family Medicine is all about getting patients to the healthiest version of themselves and keeping them there. Family physicians put the emphasis on the preventive therapies. They pride themselves in caring for the whole patient, not a specific organ system or problem.

Muhamid Asif, MD believes in a patient centered and family oriented care. He would like to be the key resource for his patients and empower them by providing appropriate medical information in plain English. Through education and motivational interviewing, he hopes they feel supported to make healthy decisions.

While he enjoys helping patients of all ages and treating all health conditions, Dr. Asifâ€™s special interests include metabolic disorders including diabetes, hyperlipidemia, obesity, and medically supervised weight loss. He enjoys being hands on and offering patients procedural care in the clinic including wound care, skin biopsies, toe nail removal, long term contraception insertion/removal, diabetic foot care and lumps/bumps.

On a personal level, Dr. Asif and his wife enjoy exploring whenever possible with hikes and mountain biking trails. They also love traveling and experiencing new foods and cultures.

title: Hana J Awada-Mitchell CNM - Midwifery - Sylvania, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Hana J Awada-Mitchell CNM
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Hana J. Awada-Mitchell, CNM is a certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with fewer medical interventions.

Care philosophy: To Hana, midwifery is a practice of women-centered care. She believes it is her role to empower women to take an active role in their healthcare and work in partnership as she supports them through any life event. Whether it is pregnancy, childbirth, gynecologic issues, or general wellness, Hana looks to provide space where all women are felt well cared for and respected.

More about me: When Hana is not caring for women, she enjoys spending her time traveling, staying active, and being with friends and family and caring for her three girls. She is originally from Toledo/Sylvania and is excited to care for women in her community.

content.biography:
Melissa Baer, MD is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN).

Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.

Dr. Baer enjoys helping women through pregnancy and welcoming new life into the world, as well as assisting women with unique issues such as abnormal bleeding, pelvic pain and menopause. She loves educating patients and finds it really important for patients to have a better understanding of their body and what is normal and what is not normal. She enjoys educating patients about the issues they might be having and the risks and benefits to treatments so that patients can make educated decisions about their health care.

title: Jenna Bailey OD - Optometry - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Jenna Bailey OD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Jenna Bailey, OD is a residency-trained optometrist with a special interest in ocular disease, contact lenses, and comprehensive eye care for children and adults. She grew up in a small town in Pennsylvania and carried on the legacy of her local eye doctor, Dr. Kulback. Her care philosophy involves listening to her patients' concerns and trying to make their experience in her office positive and memorable. She truly believes that patient education is essential to a good doctor-patient relationship and she treats patients as if they were her family members. 

Dr. Bailey's clinical interests include treatment and management of ocular disease including glaucoma, diabetes, dry eye, retinal conditions, binocular vision issues and red eyes as well as management of refractive error including glasses and contacts.

Dr. Bailey completed a residency in ocular disease and management many sight and life-threatening conditions. She is a member of the Ohio Optometric Association and the American Optometric Association. She has presented case studies at national conferences during her residency and presented at local conferences for continuing education to her peers. 

She enjoys playing a variety of sports including tennis, golf, running and lifting. Dr. Bailey loves raveling to different parts of the world to hike and explore different cultures. A fun fact about here is that she has a second degree black belt in martial arts.

content.name: Jeffrey M Bair MD

content.biography:
As an orthopaedic trauma surgeon specializing in the treatment of broken bones and their complications, Dr. Jeffery Bair treats injured patients during the difficult and challenging period of time after a traumatic event. This may as mild as trip and fall in the backyard or after a high-energy motor vehicle crash.

Dr. Bair's goal is to help patients by restoring their function after musculoskeletal injuries. Enabling them to maintain a quality of life by getting back to work, keeping active at home, enjoying hobbies and living independently. He collaborates with his trauma colleagues to provide high quality care to thier acutely injured patients.

Dr. Bair has helped to establish the Geriatric Hip Fracture Program â€“ now a JCAHO certified, recognized program at both ProMedia Toledo and Flower Hospitals.

Dr. Bair is involved with resident education both through the University of Toledo, but also at a national level as an AO Faculty member â€“ integral for teaching fracture care to orthopaedic residents across the country.

content.biography:
Christine Barchick, PA-C works in a busy trauma orthopaedic office diagnosing, managing and caring for acute fractures and sequela from other traumatic injuries. She also works in the inpatient and outpatient follow up setting and runs the osteoporosis fracture liaison service diagnosing and managing osteoporosis.

Christine's philosophy of care includes providing her patients with the most up to date medical care with compassionate care as she would want her family members to be treated.

Christine was raised in Toledo, graduated from Michigan State University with a degree in human biology and returned to Toledo to obtain her masters in physician assistant studies at the University of Toledo. She was excited to return home to provide care to her community. Christine also has certification in the treatment of osteoporosis as a special interest in risk reduction of future fractures.

title: Tracy L Bartson APRN, CNM - Midwifery - Fremont, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Tracy L Bartson APRN, CNM
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Tracy L. Bartson, APRN, CNM is a certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who provide reproductive primary care and who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions.

Philosophy of care: To hone into the individual needs of each woman while encouraging autonomy by being active participants in their care plan. Tracy's goal is to empower women with up-to-date education and evidenced-based practice while instilling confidence in their ability to achieve healthy outcomes. She assures respect and privacy while promoting involvement of significant others per patient consent.

Clinical interests: Education to adolescents and young adults on the variety of norms of the female reproductive system and sexual health. For pregnant and laboring patients, education on the impact of daily exercise and Spinning Babies techniques in regards to maintaining comfort and healthy outcomes. Additionally, helping women navigate the challenges of menopause with safe appropriate use of hormone replacement therapy and adjunct medication.

More about me: Tracy enjoys nature. It keeps her grounded to be outdoors hiking, camping, backpacking, kayaking and gardening. Tracy's outlook is that inclement weather should not hold her back. Maintaining a calm, positive attitude in harsh conditions keeps her prepared for challenges in other areas of life.

content.biography:
ProMedica Ear, Nose and Throat, the largest otolaryngology practice in northwest Ohio, provides comprehensive management of disorders involving the ears, nose and throat and other related structures of the head and neck region. Additionally, our physician-led team includes advance practice providers, audiologists and speech therapists. Our priority is to provide patient-centered care that is entirely focused on improving your health and well-being. We provide medical and surgical treatments for a wide range of conditions. Our approach to patient-centered care is what makes the ProMedica ENT patient experience unique.

Dr. Baxter is a board certified physician with the American Osteopathic Board of Ophthalmology & Otolaryngology-Head & Neck Surgery. She is a Fellow with the American Academy of Otolaryngic Allergy. She holds active memberships with the following professional societies: American Academy of Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery, American Osteopathic College of Ophthalmology and Otolaryngology- Head and Neck Surgery, and American Academy of Otolaryngic Allergy. 

Special procedures that Dr. Baxter performs include: Hyoid suspension for sleep apnea, snoring injection procedure, sialoendoscopy, eustachian tuboplasty, cosmetic and functional rhinoplasty, otoplasty.

Learn more about ear, nose and throat care at ProMedica

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Physicians Orthopaedics l Trauma and Adult Reconstruction

content.biography:
Meghan Beck, PA-C is an orthopedic physician assistant that has been working in the acute orthopededic trauma setting since 2010. She manages orthopedic trauma inpatients and outpatients both independently and in collaboration with our orthopedic trauma attendings. Meghan is also first assist in the operating room. She also treats patients for primary and secondary fracture prevention in a bone health program.

Meghan's philosophy of care involves providing evidence based, best practice care while also treating patients as she would want to be treated. 

She obtained her Bachelorâ€™s degree from the University of Dayton while also being a member of their division 1 womenâ€™s soccer program. Meghan returned to Toledo to obtain her Masterâ€™s degree at the University of Toledo in their physician assistant program. She completed a fracture liaison certificate through the national osteoporosis foundation. In 2018, Meghan was awarded a risk management grant to create a fracture liaison service at ProMedica to improve the quality of fracture prevention care for patients that have sustained a fragility fracture. She also helped create a secondary fracture prevention program to help manage patients who are at increased risk for additional fractures

Meghan grew up in Toledo and returned to raise her family and provide orthopedic care to her community.
education:
Graduate Education
University of Toledo

He treats arthritic hips and knees with conservative measures (medication, therapy, injections) until the patient reaches end stage disease causing disabling pain and loss of function of involved joint. 

Dr. Beer participated in advanced training to learn the Anterior Total Hip procedure at age 55 and is certified in the Oxford Partial Knee Advanced instructional course

He states that his spiritual life is very important to him and he tries to incorporate it in his professional life by being aware of his patientsâ€™ spiritual needs.

content.biography:
Brooke Bellman, CNM is a board-certified nurse-midwife.

Midwives are trained professionals who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions.

Care philosophy: Brooke's care philosophy is centered on helping women make the best decisions regarding their health and well-being in a holistic fashion. She enjoys caring for women from all backgrounds of life.

More about me: Brooke has spend the majority of her nursing career in the Toledo-area, caring for women and girls of multiple generations in the community. Brooke feels fortunate to have been involved with the care of many her family, friends and co-workers who have babies. She has a reputation as the "baby whisperer" when it comes to rocking a baby to sleep. Brooke enjoys people and feels it is special to have the privilege to care for multiple generations by referral.

content.name: Lauren Blanchard PA-C
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Lauren Blanchard, PA-C, is a certified physician assistant in vascular surgery and medicine.  Vascular medicine involves the study of blood vessels outside of the heart and the lymphatic system.  Vascular medicine specialists study the diseases of the veins, arteries, and connective tissues.  Vascular surgeons provide the surgical treatment of disease in the circulatory system outside of the heart and brain.  Additionally, patients have access to vascular services including vascular testing and rehabilitation, wound care, anticoagulation care, and specialized treatment for varicose and spider veins.

Lauren believes that compassionate care and individualized attention provide the foundation to build a patient-provider relationship that encompasses trust and respect.  Through the aspects of patient education, Lauren's goal is to achieve the highest-level care for the patients of Jobst Vascular Institute, working together to achieve better health and well-being.

title: Alice Bonnell MD - Pediatric Urology - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Alice Bonnell MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationAddress:
2120 W. Central Ave.
Suite D.
Toledo, OH 43606

content.biography:
Alice Bonnell, MD, is a board certified pediatric urologist. Pediatric urology is a surgical specialty that focuses on the evaluation, management, and treatment of urinary and genital issues seen in children. If a child has illness associated with the urinary tract (kidneys, ureters, bladder, and/or urethra) or with the genitalia, pediatric urologists are trained to care for these conditions whether it be through medical management or surgical treatment.

Care philosophy: Dr. Bonnell's goal is to provide quality urologic care to children and their families. She believes that each patient is unique and deserves a care plan designed specifically for their circumstances. She also wants to help educate families so that they better understand the condition for which their child is being treated and can better make the most appropriate choices to direct the care of their child.

Dr. Bonnell completed her training at Cincinnati Childrenâ€™s Hospital with an emphasis on complex reconstruction. She has experience in caring for patients that require a multidisciplinary team. She values the importance of communication between pediatric providers to deliver the best care for children with multiple or complex medical issues.

More about me: Dr. Bonnell did not always have a career in medicine. She was a fine arts/music high school teacher prior to going to medical school.

conditionsProcedures: Hemorrhoids, anal fissure and perianal fistula
Laparoscopic Minimally Invasive Colon and Rectal Surgery
content.biography:
Dr. Raul Bosio is a board-certified colon and rectal surgeon. He graduated from the University of Cordoba School of Medicine in 1997 as valedictorian. He completed a five-year general surgery residency at the Hospital Aleman of Buenos Aires, Argentina, followed by a 2-year colon and rectal surgery fellowship at the Hospital Italiano of Buenos Aires. He has been involved in minimally invasive laparoscopic colon and rectal surgery since the early 2000s.  

In 2005, he joined the department of surgery at the University of Toledo, and was involved in colon and rectal cancer research, as well as participating in basic science, translational, and clinical research. In 2011, Dr. Bosio completed an ACGME- accredited general surgery residency at The University of Toledo and became board-certified in general surgery. He completed further training by repeating his fellowship in colon and rectal surgery at the University of California, Irvine. During this time, he acquired significant expertise in minimally invasive laparoscopic colon and rectal surgery and robotic colorectal surgery, working under the mentorship of world-renowned experts.

Dr. Bosioâ€™s areas of interest include diagnosis, treatment and long-term follow- up of patients with colon and rectal cancer, inflammatory bowel disease (Crohnâ€™s disease and ulcerative colitis), and diverticular disease and associated complications (i.e. colovesical fistula, diverticulitis, stricture, colon perforation or obstruction). Dr. Raul Bosio joined ProMedica Physicians in 2016, after being part of the colon & rectal surgery section at Case Western/University Hospitals in Cleveland.

Dr. Bosio understood long ago that being an excellent physician requires excellent surgical results and the ability to listen to patients and families, while taking the time to explain the disease and the proposed treatment plan. A patient-centered approach ensures treatment options are chosen based on the patientâ€™s individual needs and preferences. As part of the process of striving for excellent outcomes, restoring or improving patientâ€™s quality of life is of paramount importance in Dr. Bosioâ€™s care philosophy. As it is often the case when treating patients with chronic diseases, Dr. Bosio and his health care team focus on working with the patient
and family to make sure they know there is a team of professionals  with them, no matter how hard it may get. Close and frequent communication with multiple health care providers, from PCPs, gastroenterologists, oncologists and others, ensures the primary focus remains on improving the health and well-being of every patient.

Dr. Raul Bosio is part of ProMedica Physicians General Surgery and focuses on colon and rectal surgery. His practice is located in the ProMedica Health and Wellness Center, where he works alongside some of the best general surgery specialists in the area. He has been an integral member of this multi-specialty general surgery practice since 2016. Close collaboration between subspecialties allows for improved patient care across the spectrum of gastrointestinal pathologies and abdominal wall issues (i.e. complex ventral hernias). Multimodal surgical solutions are offered to patients with complex diseases, such as those requiring combined procedures or may benefit from multi-organ resections.

Dr. Bosio has a faculty appointment as a Clinical Assistant Professor of Surgery at The University of Toledo, College of Medicine and Life Sciences.

I grew up in the Toledo area and earned a Bachelor's in Exercise Science and Doctorate of Physical Therapy degree at The University of Toledo. I gained experience as a sports and orthopedic PT primarily working with endurance athletes prior to entering pelvic health. I am a mom of two and always on the go. Helping other women is my dream job!

Care Philosophy

I believe in working with my patients as a teammate advocating for them and empowering them to achieve their treatment goals. I am passionate about treating patients holistically and providing evidenced based education and treatment techniques to ensure the best care.

content.biography:
ProMedica Ear, Nose and Throat, the largest otolaryngology practice in northwest Ohio, provides comprehensive management of disorders involving the ears, nose and throat and other related structures of the head and neck region. Additionally, our physician-led team includes advance practice providers, audiologists and speech therapists. Our priority is to provide patient-centered care that is entirely focused on improving your health and well-being. We provide medical and surgical treatments for a wide range of conditions. Our approach to patient-centered care is what makes the ProMedica ENT patient experience unique.

Learn more about ear, nose and throat care at ProMedica

Dr. Charnesky is a board certified physician with the American Osteopathic Board of Ophthalmology & Otolaryngology-Head & Neck Surgery. She is an Associate Professor at the Michigan State University College of Osteopathic Medicine and the University of Toledo. She holds active memberships with the following professional societies: American Academy of Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery, American Osteopathic College of Ophthalmology and Otolaryngology Head & Neck Surgery, American Osteopathic Association, and American Academy of Otolaryngic Allergy.

Special procedures that Dr. Charnesky performs include: In-office Balloon Sinuplast and Earwells (newborn correction of auricle/ear malformations).

content.biography:
William Colyer, Jr., MD, FACC, FSCAI is a cardiologist. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Dr. Colyer is board-certified in cardiovascular disease, interventional cardiology, and internal medicine.

Care philosophy: He believes in treating each individual as an individual. He is committed to practicing evidence-based medicine to help patients live longer, better, and fuller lives.

Clinical interests: Dr. Colyer is interested in treating chronic coronary artery disease and angina.

Conditions treated: Heart attack/acute coronary syndrome, coronary artery disease, angina, congestive heart failure, and elevated cholesterol.

Procedures/treatments performed: Complex coronary intervention, revascularization of chronic total occlusion, stenting, echocardiogram/transesophageal echocardiogram, and stress testing.

More about me: Dr. Colyer has been involved in organizations including the American College of Cardiology and the Society for Cardiovascular Angiography and Interventions at both the state and national level.

content.biography:
Madeleine Craig, MD is an obstetrician/gynecologist. Obstetrics is the field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period, after the baby is born. Gynecology is a womenâ€™s health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists can also help diagnose cervical, uterine, and ovarian cancer. They treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate and counsel on contraception.

Care philosophy: Dr. Craigâ€™s care philosophy is centered around listening and collaboration. She believes in listening to her patientsâ€™ biggest questions and concerns, reviewing the most up-to-date and pertinent treatment options a patient may have, and deciding upon a plan together.

Conditions treated: Routine and high-risk pregnancies, painful or irregular menstrual periods. Contraception, fibroids, sexual health, menopause, routine screening

Procedures performed: Minimally invasive (robotic) surgery, including hysterectomy, removal of fallopian tubes (salpingectomy) or ovaries (oophorectomy); endometrial ablation, hysteroscopy

More about me: Dr. Craig grew up all over the country, but found her home in Northwest Ohio with her husband and two golden retrievers. In her spare time, youâ€™ll find her enjoying the great food Toledo has to offer, watching a Wolverine or Green Bay football game, or cooking a new recipe.

title: Kevin Creedon APRN-CNP - Cardiology - Maumee, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Kevin Creedon APRN-CNP
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Kevin Creedon, CNP is a certified nurse practitioner in acute care that specializes in cardiology. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Kevin is certified through the American Association of Critical Care Nurses and the Ohio Board of Nursing (for both my RN and APRN). He also has his ACLS and BLS through the American Heart Association.

Care philosophy: His goal is to care for patients to his utmost ability with a compassionate mindset to provide the most appropriate and timely care. Kevin also believes in treating patients like he would treat his family. He is a relaxed individual that will not judge based on prior life choices or circumstances and will provide clinically appropriate care.

Conditions treated: Coronary artery disease, congested heart failure, arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation, SVT, bradycardia, cardiomyopathy/congestive heart failure, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, valvular heart disease, vascular primary prevention, pulmonary hypertension, and dysautonomia/POTS.

More about me: Kevin was an ICU nurse for roughly seven years before becoming a nurse practitioner and has only been a nurse practitioner in cardiology. In addition to cardiology, he is also interested in nephrology and pulmonary.

He is from Pittsburgh, PA and enjoys sports (football, baseball, lacrosse, and hockey), especially his hometown teams.

He and his fellow cardiothoracic surgeons strive to make national level care available to patients in the NW Ohio and SE Michigan so that they do not have to travel hours away from their families to receive top-notch treatment. In fact, the quality of care, outcomes and treatment they offer are consistently ranked among the top in the country by credible rating agencies and professional and trade organizations like The Society for Thoracic Surgeons.

content.biography:
Care philosophy: Dr. Crim thinks it is important to address patientsâ€™ needs with a team approach to care. With her support team and her patientâ€™s support team working together towards a common discussed goal, we can provide excellent care and achieve amazing outcomes. It is important that the patientâ€™s goals are always addressed and are the center of the physician/patient determined care plan.

Dr. Crim is a native of Birmingham, Alabama and fell in love with Ohio during training. She and her family are actually looking forward to true winter weather again. Dr. Crim finds humor to be an important part of forming patient relationships since laughter is the best medicine. She is a passionate advocate of womenâ€™s health care and hopes to make a difference for the women in northwest Ohio and the surrounding areas.

For full disclosure purposes, she likes her patients and families to be aware that she is a huge University of Alabama fan. Roll tide!

Special interests: Gynecologic malignancies including ovarian, uterine, cervical, and vulvar cancers. Risk reduction of hereditary gynecologic malignancies. Complex gynecologic/pelvic surgery. Particular interest in minimally invasive surgical techniques including laparoscopic and robotic approaches where appropriate. Management of chemotherapeutic treatment for gynecologic malignancies including consideration for personalized genomic targeted therapy and evaluation for clinical trials.

Conditions treated: Gynecologic malignancies including ovarian, uterine, cervical, and vulvar cancers.

Procedures performed: Robotic, laparoscopic, vaginal, and open approaches to complex pelvic surgery. Radical cytoreductive surgery in the management of gynecologic malignancies.

content.biography:
Dr. Currie specializes in comprehensive ophthalmology with a special interest in cataract surgery, including laser assisted cataract surgery and advanced technology intraocular lenses.

It is an exciting time to be a cataract surgeon because the technology continues to advance and provide better outcomes for patients. At the same time, there are a seemingly overwhelming number of options for cataract surgery. Dr. Currie partners with each patient to personalize the best treatment course and timing.

In his spare time, Dr. Currie enjoys reading philosophy and history, spending time with friends and family, and playing croquet.

content.biography:
Kevin Dankert, DO is a physical medicine and rehabilitation/sports medicine physician focusing on acute or chronic medical conditions affecting the spine, muscles, joints, and nerves. He takes a holistic approach in addressing both the pain and function in relation to these conditions. Dr. Dankert has a strong interest in interventional treatments including precise image guided injections using fluoroscopy or ultrasound and using regenerative medicine options such as platelets are stem cells in addition to the more traditional treatment options.

Dr. Dankert was born and raised in Toledo and currently provides sports medicine coverage for the University Of Toledo Men's basketball team as well as coverage for Anthony Wayne High School.

content.biography:
Jamie L Dargart, MD is a pediatric hematologist/oncologist.

As Pediatric Hematologists and Oncologists, we specialize in the diagnosis and treatment of blood diseases (hematology) and cancers (oncology) in children.

Care philosophy: I believe that treating children should involve a team - the child, his or her parents or other caregivers, the physician, and other healthcare providers.

More About Dr. Dargart

My special interests include treating children, adolescents and young adults with cancer and participation in clinical trials for children with cancer. I serve as Principal Investigator for the Childrenâ€™s Oncology Group (COG) at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Childrenâ€™s Hospital. We are the only childrenâ€™s cancer center in Northwest Ohio to participate in COG, the worldâ€™s largest organization devoted exclusively to pediatric cancer research.

I am a native of Toledo.

content.biography:
Hassan Dbouk MD, FAAP specializes in pediatric critical care medicine, pediatric pulmonary medicine, and sleep medicine.

Critical care, also known as intensive care, involves the treatment of children who have been injured seriously or have life-threatening illnesses.

Pulmonary medicine focuses on the lungs and breathing. The goal of pulmonary medicine is preventing, diagnosing, and treating diseases of the lung.

Sleep medicine is concerned with the diagnosis and treatment of sleep problems. Common sleep disorders include chronic insomnia, sleep apnea, restless legs, and sleepwalking.

Care philosophy: Dr. Dbouk practices medicine as a part of a multidisciplinary team to provide patients with state-of-the-art comprehensive care.

content.biography:
Angela Diuble, PA-C is a certified physician assistant in family medicine, providing comprehensive care for both children and adults.

Angela grew up in Manchester, Michigan. She has attended Michigan State University, Eastern Michigan University, Washtenaw Community College, and finally obtained her Masterâ€™s Degree and PA specialty at Medical College of Ohio, now known as University of Toledo Medical School. Angela is a former high school science educator and volleyball coach.


Angela is proud to represent the PA profession and precepts PA students regularly.

In her free time, Angela works diligently with her family non-profit, Diuble Family Vision, to support the needs of people with hearing and vision loss and to raise money for research to cure blinding eye diseases.

Angela is a Saline Lions Club member and is involved in many types of community service.

Angela believes in working with my patients as a teammate advocating for them and empowering them to achieve their treatment goals. She is passionate about treating patients holistically and providing evidenced based education and treatment techniques to ensure the best care.

title: Robert Drenchko DO - Obstetrics - Sylvania, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Robert Drenchko DO
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Robert Drenchko, DO is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN). 

Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.

Care philosophy: While attending the University of Michigan, Dr. Drenchko rowed varsity crew. Being a student-athlete for four years largely inspired his philosophy of a team approach to healthcare. The patient is always the team leader and he serves to be a promotional aspect of her healthcare journey.

More about me: Dr. Drenchko was raised in Shelby Township, Michigan. His father was an OB/GYN and his mother was a figure skating instructor. When he is not practicing medicine, he enjoys staying active; training at a gym or being outdoors. He loves to spend time with his family and friends. He's also a car and motorcycle enthusiast and can often be found riding his motorcycle at local raceways.

A huge passion of Dr. Drenchko's is education. He is always working to educate himself through evidence-based literature and presentations. He is part of ProMedica's quality committee because providing exceptional evidenced based care is very important to him. He works hard to educate his patients so they can make informed decisions about their care. He also always looks forward to educating resident physicians and medical students. Dr. Drenchko is grateful and excited to be part of the new wave in promoting and optimizing womenâ€™s health care.
education:
Medical School
Lake Erie College of Osteopathic Medicine, Erie, PA

Residency
The University of Toledo College of Medicine and Life Sciences, Toledo, Ohio

Undergraduate Education
University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, Mich.

content.biography:
Dr. Essel is a fellowship-trained gynecologic oncologist who is passionate about delivering high-quality, evidenced-based, compassionate care to all patients. In addition to caring for women with gynecologic cancers, she is interested in quality improvement in healthcare to improve patient outcomes, as well as in multi-disciplinary collaboration to deliver the highest level of care to all patients.

She was born and raised in San Antonio, Texas and went to college in Boston prior to returning to the southwest for her medical training. Dr. Essel met her husband in medical school who imbued her with a deep love for the Texas Longhorns. She enjoys spending time with her husband and family. Otherwise, she enjoys hiking, cooking, and watching college football.

content.biography:
I have been a Physician Assistant in the specialty of General Surgery since 1990, and in Bariatric Surgery since 2001.

I treat patients as I would my own family.  If they can go home to their families after our encounter and relay what we discussed and the plan, then I feel I have done my job.

I am interested in improving patient's health and functional status through weight loss surgery, postoperative follow-up and repeated education.

I enjoy providing mentorship to Physician Assistant/Medical students, residents and fellows.

I grew up in Lakewood, Ohio.  I move to Toledo in 1999 for my career.  I have been married more than 25 years to my wonderful wife Vicky, and we are blessed with three boys, Samuel, Christian and John.  I enjoy spending time with my family.

content.biography:
Jobst Vascular Institute is a world-renown vascular center that provides patients access to comprehensive vascular services including: vascular testing, vascular rehabilitation, wound care, anticoagulation care, clinical trials, and specialized treatment for varicose and spider veins.

The physicians of ProMedica Physicians Jobst Vascular and Jobst Vascular Institute all are board certified in vascular disease. With 15 office locations across northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan, we are committed to providing our patients and their families with high quality, innovative, and patient-centered care.

Dr. Fish hails from the suburban Chicagoland area and prior to 2015 was in paradise in Milwaukee, WI. He speaks German and received some of his vascular training in Innsbruck, Austria. He enjoys boating, skiing, music of all kinds and spending time with his family.

title: Megan Floyd APRN, CNM - Obstetrics - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Megan Floyd APRN, CNM
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:

content.biography:
Jeffrey Forquer, MD, is board-certified by the American Board of Radiology. He puts the interests of his patients first and participates in a multidisciplinary team approach that includes not just radiation treatment, but education and emotional support in a warm, healing environment. Dr. Forquer believes the best patient care is delivered when the patient and physician have a good relationship, and the physician understands the goals and needs of the patient.

Dr. Forquer and the ProMedica Physicians Radiation Oncology team provide exceptional cancer care close to home, with facilities located in Sylvania, Maumee, and Fremont, Ohio and Adrian and Monroe, Michigan. Services also include holistic treatment, social work, and dietary.

State-of-the-art diagnostic tests, treatments and supportive therapies: 3-D conformal radiation therapy, High Dose Rate (HDR) brachytherapy, electron radiation therapy, image-guided radiation therapy (IGRT), intensity modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), radiopharmaceuticals, stereotactic body radiation therapy (SBRT), stereotactic radiosurgery (SRS), *SpaceOARâ„¢, Prostate Brachytherapy.

content.biography:
Lisa Franco, CNP is a certified nurse practitioner in obstetrics/gynecology. 

Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born.

Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.

Care philosophy: Lisa cares for women across their lifespan and loves her job. She believes it is important to provide care by acknowledging each woman's individuality while providing unconditional, compassionate care, educating patients and their families, and striving to promote a healthcare environment that is therapeutic and respectful of all women. 

Clinical interests: Lisa is passionate about breastfeeding and helping moms and their babies meet their infant feeding goals.

More about me: Prior to becoming a nurse practitioner, Lisa was a labor and delivery nurse. She is married and lives locally. She has give grown children and loves to travel and spend time with her family. She also enjoys watching baseball and hockey.

content.biography:
In addition to earning her Master of Art Degree in Counseling from Spring Arbor University, Heather Frederick, LPC, CAADC, CCS, CCTP, has also worked to obtain several certifications: certified advanced alcohol and drug counselor (CAADC,) certified clinical supervisor (CCS) and certified clinical trauma professional. She is a board member with Recovery Advocacy Warriors (RAW,) suicide prevention coalition of Monroe County, and a state organizer for Michigan Recovery Advocacy Project.

Heather's experience includes providing co-occurring treatment for individual, family and group mental health, and substance abuse counseling for adolescents and adults within various settings such as inpatient, outpatient, primary care, school-based, federally qualified health center and prisons. She has additional training to provide driverâ€™s license assessments, utilization of SASSI to assess level of care and other assessment tools. Heather was involved in a primary care research study for SBIRT which has been shown to be an effective link for individuals treatment of addiction. In therapy, she utilizes ACT approaches, Dialectical Behavioral Therapy (DBT) with a focus on mindfulness, distress tolerance and emotion regulation, Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT,) Rational Emotive Behavioral Therapy (REBT,) solution-focused, person-centered therapy, motivational interviewing and additional open-ended concepts. She also provides supervision for professionals in private practice sectors and non-profit agencies that are on a development plan for their CAADC certification and are limited licensed.  Heather supports others in the field and provides consultation as needed.

title: ProMedica Physicians Gynecology Oncology

content.name: Anjalika Gandhi MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
conditionsProcedures: Gynecologic Malignancies (including ovarian, uterine, cervical, and vulvar)
Management of chemotherapeutic treatment for gynecologic malignancies, including consideration for personalized genomic targeted therapy and evaluation for clinical trials
content.biography:
Dr. Gandhi is a fellowship-trained gynecologic oncologist who treats all patients with cancers of the female reproductive tract. Her approach is to manage her whole patient, not just their cancer. She sees cancer care as a journey and wishes to be your guide and partner at every step, from meticulous surgical intervention and targeted chemotherapy or radiation to clinical trials, treatment breaks, survivorship, and/or palliative care. Your goals, support systems, resources, and identities are unique, and navigating each of these is part of a tailoring your comprehensive cancer care plan. Our extensive healthcare team will use all the tools at our disposal to achieve the best outcome for you.

A native of the Chicagoland area, Dr. Gandhi has completed her training in different parts of the country, including Pennsylvania, Ohio, Florida, and Oklahoma. This has allowed her to engage with patients of various backgrounds and belief systems and customize her clinical approach. As a woman of South Asian descent with strong family ties, she understands how ethnicity and culture can influence relationships with the healthcare system. She remains connected to her cultural heritage through Indian performing arts.

Special interests: Diversity, equity, and inclusion in healthcare; fertility-sparing surgery, targeted therapeutics, clinical trial recruitment, palliative care.

content.biography: Susan has been with the ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Childrenâ€™s Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center since October 2021. She has been in the field of Applied Behavior Analysis since 2015, beginning as a 1:1 behavior technician. She has a Bachelor of Arts in psychology and a Master of Arts in special education. She became a Board Certified Behavior Analyst, Certified Ohio Behavior Analyst, and Licensed Behavior Analyst (Michigan) in 2020. Before that, Susan spent many years working with students of all ages teaching 1:1 and in small groups. Susan loves to see children and adults gain skills and understanding of new topics. In her free time, Susan spends time with her husband, five adult children, and four former foster children. She also enjoys outdoor activities and exercise.

title: Kellen Goldschmidt MD - Obstetrics - Perrysburg, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Kellen Goldschmidt MD
content.location: ProMedica Physicians Obstetrics | Gynecology - Levis Commons
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Physicians Obstetrics | Gynecology - Levis Commons

content.biography:
Kellen Goldschmidt, MD is an obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN). Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born.

Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.

Care philosophy: Listening to the patient is at the center of Dr. Goldschmidt's care philosophy. Together, she considers the patient's concerns, questions and plans and with the most up-to-date recommendations in women's health to make a plan to meet her health goals. Dr. Goldschmidt hopes each patient walks away from their visit feeling heard, cared for and with information to help them make informed decisions about their healthcare.

Conditions treated: Routine and high-risk pregnancy, menopause, abnormal menstrual bleeding, painful periods, contraception, endometriosis, fibroids, sexual health.

Procedures performed: Minimally-invasive hysterectomy, endometrial ablation, removal of fallopian tubes (salpingectomy), removal of ovaries (oophorectomy), fibroid removal (myomectomy)

More about me: Dr. Goldschmidt grew up in northern Minnesota and have been making her way east with each step of training. She and her husband settled into Toledo, Ohio after enjoying time here during her OB/GYN residency. She loves being outside, being active and spending time with her dog, Louie.

content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationAddress:
730 N. Macomb St.
Suite 200
Monroe, MI 48162

content.biography:
Dr. Tracy L. Gomez is a licensed psychologist and the Director of Outpatient Clinical Services at ProMedica Behavioral Health - Monroe where she provides psychological testing. Her doctorate is in Clinical Psychology from Capella University in Minneapolis, Minnesota.

She is passionate about educating psychology students and is an online adjunct faculty member at Liberty University, Lynchburg, Virginia. She is an instructor for Mental Health First Aid for Adult and Youth (6 hour and 8 hour courses), with modules specific to Higher Education, Fire and EMS, Public Service Personnel and Veterans. She teaches in person, remote, and a hybrid of in person learning and remote.

Dr. Gomez has over 25 years of experience in the Monroe community where she provided services to individuals in crisis and leadership oversight in a community mental health setting. She also has worked for the court system, writing and obtaining a grant for the 1st District Court to begin a mental health specialty court.

title: Patricia Graffice FNP-C - Cardiology - Maumee, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Patricia Graffice FNP-C
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Patricia Graffice, FNP-C is an advanced practice provider for cardiology. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Patricia started with her family nurse practitioner certification in 2008 before there were a lot of subspecialty nurse practitioner options. She then decided to further her formal education and obtained her adult geriatric acute care post-masterâ€™s certification in 2019, with board certification in 2020.

Care philosophy: Her goal is to treat patients as she would her own family and educate them, so they understand their health and have a better quality of life.

Conditions treated: Coronary artery disease, congested heart failure, arrhythmias (atrial fibrillation, SVT, bradycardia), cardiomyopathy/congestive heart failure, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, valvular heart disease, vascular primary prevention, pulmonary hypertension, dysautonomia/POTS.

More about me: Patricia has been passionate about cardiology for more than 20 years. Half of which she spent practicing as a nurse practitioner. The other half as a cardiac stepdown/ICU nurse.

Her interest in cardiology started when she was 14 years old. That's when her cousin died at age 6 after her third open heart surgery. Her interested deepened when she did her nursing clinicals at Medical College of Ohio (MCO) on the cardiac stepdown floor.

content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
conditionsProcedures: Safe Return to Exercise Post Partum
content.biography:
More About Me

Sarah Griffith PT, DPT, OCS is an orthopedic and pelvic health physical therapist who has a passion for helping women return to normal function and their favorite physical activities. She is a board certified Orthopedic Clinical Specialist by the ABPTS. As a young mom herself, she especially enjoys and easily relates to patients in the early post-partum period. Sarah is an exercise enthusiast, has trained for triathlons and has a passion for nutrition and all things food. In her spare time, you will find her in the kitchen or spending time with her husband and two active little boys.

Care philosophy

I believe in a holistic approach to treatment; that the mind and body are strongly connected and must be treated concurrently for the best outcomes. I focus heavily on education with patients to help them understand how their bodies work, what their current impairments are and how to take ownership and control back into their own hands. My early career was heavily sports and orthopedic based, so now I combine my passion for an active lifestyle with women's health to help women return to the activities they love. It is important for the patient and provider to have a great teamwork relationship. My goal is to help patients achieve their goals, whether that is returning to daily activities, being active or even running a marathon!

Conditions Treated

Pelvic pain, perinatal and postpartum pain/dysfunction, diastasis recti, adolescent pelvic dysfunction and pain, urinary/fecal incontinence, myofascial pain, low back and hip pain, dyspareunia (painful sex), pelvic organ prolapse, somatic pelvic dysfunction

Procedures Performed

Pelvic floor physical therapy, manual therapy techniques, myofascial release, kinesiotaping, soft tissue mobilization, gait and running analysis. Patient education regarding fluid management, bladder and bowel education.
education:
Doctoral Studies
University of Toledo

Undergraduate Education
University of Toledo

title: Michael Grillis DO, FACOS - General Surgery - Fremont, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Michael Grillis DO, FACOS
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Michael Grillis, DO, FACOS, is a board-certified general surgeon. General surgery is a surgical specialty that focuses on abdominal contents including esophagus, stomach, small intestine, large intestine, liver, pancreas, gallbladder, appendix and bile ducts.

Care philosophy: Dr. Grillis believes in treating patients the way he would want himself or his family members to be treated.

Conditions treated: Biliary disease, colon cancer, diseases of the small bowel, gastroesophageal reflux, and hernias.

Procedures performed: Breast cancer operations, endoscopy, minimally invasive surgery, and robotic surgery.

More about me: Dr. Grillis is a Fellow of the American College of Osteopathic Surgeons. He enjoys teaching medical students along with interns and residents.

On a personal note, he likes to spend his spare time exercising, biking, being outdoors and traveling. He also enjoys spending time with his family and friends.

content.name: Anil K. Gupta MD, MBA
content.location: ProMedica Physicians Toledo Orthopaedic and Spine Surgeons
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Physicians Toledo Orthopaedic and Spine Surgeons

hospitalAffiliations.hospitalName: ProMedica Wildwood Orthopaedic and Spine Hospital

conditionsProcedures: Cartilage Preservation: Meniscus Repair and Transplants
content.biography:
Dr. Gupta specializes in sports medicine, shoulder surgery, hip arthroscopy, and cartilage preservation/ligament surgery of the knee. He serves as team physician for the University of Toledo Rockets, Lourdes University, Adrian College and numerous area high schools.

Dr. Gupta completed is medical training at Albany Medical College where he completed an 8-year combined Leadership in Medicine MD-MBA program, graduating with honors. During his orthopaedic residency at Duke University Medical Center, he served as chief resident and associate team physician for Duke Universityâ€™s football, basketball and soccer teams. He then completed a Sports Medicine and Shoulder surgery fellowship at Rush University Medical Center, where he was as an associate team physician for the Chicago Bulls, Chicago White Sox and DePaul University.

Dr. Gupta is an award winning researcher and has published more than 45 peer-reviewed manuscripts and has delivered numerous lectures at regional, national and international orthopaedic meetings. As an educator he is an Associate Master Instructor for the Arthroscopy Association of North America and regularly participates in educating other orthopaedic surgeons at the Orthopaedic Learning Center in Chicago.

 A former nationally ranked tennis player, in his spare time Dr. Gupta enjoys playing tennis, exercising, and spending time with his family.

title: Bridget Gustwiller PT - Physical Therapy - Defiance, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Bridget Gustwiller PT
content.biography:
More About Me

I grew up in Defiance, Ohio and earned my Bachelor of Science in Physical Therapy from Bowling Green State University/Medical College of Ohio. I began my early PT career in Morristown, NJ before moving back home to Defiance focusing early on acute care and outpatient orthopedics. Over the past eight years, I have been increasing my focus in the area of pelvic floor/women's health and have definitely found that this is an area I am extremely passionate about! I am a mother of three boys and very active in our school, church, and community. I enjoy outdoor activities and camping with our family as well as spending time with my network of girlfriends supporting each other as we navigate through motherhood.

Care Philosophy

I believe in a patient centered approach to care, advocating on their behalf for their specific concerns and treatment goals. I strive to focus on patient education for better patient understanding of their condition to empower them to achieve their best outcomes with a treatment plan specifically catered for their needs.

Conditions Treated

Pregnancy and post-partum pain, chronic pelvic pain, diastasis recti, dyspareunia (painful sex), pelvic organ prolapse, stress and urge urinary incontinence, abdominal pain, constipation, fecal incontinence.

Procedures Performed:

  • Pelvic Floor Physical Therapy
  • Manual Therapy
  • Myofascial Release
  • Soft Tissue Mobilization
  • Patient education
  • Bowel/bladder education

content.name: Taylor Kae Hahn MA, CCC-SLP
content.location: ProMedica Physicians Ear, Nose and Throat - Sylvania
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Physicians Ear, Nose and Throat - Sylvania

content.biography:
Taylor Hahn, SLP is a Toledo native who has been a speech-language pathologist for 5 years. She earned her undergraduate and graduate degrees from the University of Toledo. Taylor has extensive experience evaluating and treating with adults in many settings. She has knowledge working collaboratively with individuals diagnosed with head and neck cancers, Parkinsonâ€™s Disease, Multiple Sclerosis, stroke, etc. She has helped individuals address difficulties with their speech, language, voice, or swallowing (dysphagia).

Taylorâ€™s focus during evaluation and treatment is to put the patientâ€™s personal goals first. Quality of life is very important to Taylor and she will do her best to incorporate an individualâ€™s desires and wishes into treatment to achieve the best outcome possible. Speaking, being understood, and eating are abilities that are invaluable which is why Taylor will work hard to help her clients regain or manage their difficulties to the best of her ability.

Taylor is certified in the Lee Silverman Voice Treatment (LSVT) â€“ Loud for Parkinsonâ€™s disease and Vital Stimulation for dysphagia treatment. She has experience evaluating voice and swallowing via use of fiberoptic endoscopes to determine best course of treatment for her clients. Taylor enjoys learning about best practices in her field of speech-language pathology. She was presented the award for continuing education (ACE) from the American Speech-Language Hearing Association (ACE) in 2020. Taylor will go above and beyond to research information to ensure evidence-based practice is used for everyoneâ€™s needs.

Conditions treated: Muscle tension dysphonia (MTD), vocal nodules, unilateral or bilateral vocal fold paralysis/paresis, vocal hoarseness, difficulties with eating/swallowing/choking (dysphagia), chronic cough, tracheostomy care, laryngectomy management, pre- and post-treatment management of disorders caused by head/neck cancer.

content.biography:
Imad Hariri, MD, FACC is a cardiologist who specializes in the care of patients with advanced congestive heart failure and cardiomyopathies, or conditions that affect the function of the heart muscle.

Dr. Hariri is board-certified cardiovascular diseases, advanced heart failure and transplant cardiology, internal medicine, nuclear cardiology, and echocardiography.

Care philosophy: He believes that every patient deserves top-notch, quality care that is unique to their specific health needs. He also believes that with the patientâ€™s active participation and engagement, a team-based approach will improve how we take care of our patients.

Conditions treated: Congestive heart failure and advanced heart failure, cardiomyopathy, cardiogenic shock, left ventricular assist device (LVAD), mechanical circulatory support, cardiac sarcoidosis, and cardiac amyloidosis.

Procedures performed: Cardiac transplantation, right heart catheterization, endomyocardial biopsy, pulmonary artery sensor implantation, and invasive hemodynamic monitoring.

More about me: Dr. Hariri grew up in Toledo, Ohio, and graduated from Toledo Public Schools. He went to undergraduate school at the University of Toledo and is proud to take care of patients in the community he grew up in.

title: Tiffanie A Henderson CNP - Family Medicine - Rossford, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Tiffanie A Henderson CNP
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Tiffanie A. Henderson, CNP has been a nurse for close to 30 years and a nurse practitioner for 10 years. She was one of the last classes to graduate from St. Vincentâ€™s School of Nursing. Tiffanie's first degree was a diploma in nursing. She went on to graduate from Lourdes with her Bachelor of Science in Nursing and her Master of Science in Nursing is from the University of Cincinnati.

Tiffanie's passion for nursing started at a young age and her desire to learn more and to be able to provide more to patients is what led her to becoming a nurse practitioner. She loves the one on one with her patients and the ability to teach them to care for themselves. Tiffanie truly canâ€™t imagine doing anything different.

Tiffanie enjoys her work as a family nurse practitioner as she is able to see multiple family members which helps her better treat the family unit as a whole. She loves the variety of patients that she sees in a day; she might have a newborn well visit in one room and an 80 year old Medicare wellness visit in the next room. Tiffanie believes that patients have a desire to live a healthy life and it is her job to give them the tools to do that.

content.biography:
Kara Hertzfeld, MD, is board-certified by the American Board of Radiology.  She puts the interests of her patients first and participates in a multidisciplinary team approach that includes not just radiation treatment, but education and emotional support in a warm, healing environment. Dr. Hertzfeld believes the best patient care is delivered when the patient and physician have a good relationship, and the physician understands the goals and needs of the patient. 

Local to Toledo, Dr. Hertzfeld is a graduate from Perrysburg High School. She enjoys giving back, and being a part of the community she grew up in. 

Dr. Hertzfeld and the ProMedica Physicians Radiation Oncology team provide exceptional cancer care close to home, with facilities located in Sylvania, Maumee, and Fremont, Ohio and Adrian and Monroe, Michigan. Services also include holistic treatment, social work, and dietary.

State-of-the-art diagnostic tests, treatments and supportive therapies: 3-D conformal radiation therapy, High Dose Rate (HDR) brachytherapy, electron radiation therapy, image-guided radiation therapy (IGRT), intensity modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), radiopharmaceuticals, stereotactic body radiation therapy (SBRT), stereotactic radiosurgery (SRS), *SpaceOARâ„¢, Prostate Brachytherapy.

title: Lindsey A Hickey RN, MSN, WHNP-BC - Obstetrics - Sylvania, Ohio (OH)

content.imgAlt: Lindsey A Hickey RN, MSN, WHNP-BC
content.name: Lindsey A Hickey RN, MSN, WHNP-BC
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Lindsey Hickey, RN, MSN, WHNP-BC is a board-certified women's health nurse practitioner in obstetrics/gynecology.

Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.

Care philosophy: Lindsey believes that every person should be an active participant in their health. Her job is to help prevent and identify health problems then explain all the possible risks, benefits, and alternatives of treatment options. Then, she and her patients can work together to decide what treatment is best for them.

More about me: Lindsey chose obstetrics and gynecology because of the wide variety within the narrow focus of womenâ€™s health. She cares for women throughout their lifetime. She can educate, counsel and help women in the office setting. She becomes part of their family story when caring for them during pregnancy.
education:
Bachelor of Science in Nursing
Rush University

Master of Science in Nursing
University of Illinois

title: Jennifer Hughes APRN, CNM - Midwifery - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Jennifer Hughes APRN CNM
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Jennifer Hughes, APRN-CNM (she/her/hers) is an advanced practice registered nurse and Certified Nurse Midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who provide reproductive primary care and who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions.

She was born and raised in Northeast Ohio. She attended The Ohio State University and received her bachelor's degree in nursing in 2016. As a nurse, she worked at the James Cancer Hospital in Columbus for over five years while completing her midwifery training. In 2021, she graduated with her masterâ€™s degree in nursing from The Ohio State University where she specialized in Nurse-Midwifery and Womenâ€™s Health.

Jennifer strives to provide comprehensive, evidence-based, trauma-informed care utilizing a holistic approach. She works to support people from all backgrounds and cultural identities and their unique family structures, including LGBTQ+ affirming care. She emphasizes informed consent and seeks to empower individuals through shared-decision making throughout all aspects of her care. In labor and delivery, she aims to support individual birthing preferences and assist birthing persons in achieving low-intervention birth as desired.

The Ohio State University

Master of Science in Nursing, Midwifery

During this time, she worked with families at the Barry Family Enrichment Center utilizing the family systems approach and postmodern therapy modalities to assist clients in discovering creative solutions to their unique concerns. She then worked as a youth therapist utilizing multi-systemic therapy in an intensive family and community based program that focuses on addressing all environmental systems that affect chronic juvenile offenders and their families. Upon relocating to Ohio, Antonique worked as a school based youth therapist providing a variety of therapeutic modalities or trauma informed treatment approaches and practices to engage at risk youth who have experienced trauma. Antonique is a native of the Island Nassau, in the Bahamas and travels back regularly to visit with family and friends. She enjoys making memories with her husband, children, and friends.

content.biography:
Ryan Jin, MD, PhD, is board-certified by the American Board of Radiology. He puts the interests of his patients first and participates in a multidisciplinary team approach that includes not just radiation treatment, but education and emotional support in a warm, healing environment. Dr. Jin believes the best patient care is delivered when the patient and physician have a good relationship, and the physician understands the goals and needs of the patient.

Dr. Jin and the ProMedica Physicians Radiation Oncology team provide exceptional cancer care close to home, with facilities located in Sylvania, Maumee, and Fremont, Ohio and Adrian and Monroe, Michigan. Services also include holistic treatment, social work, and dietary.

State-of-the-art diagnostic tests, treatments and supportive therapies: 3-D conformal radiation therapy, High Dose Rate (HDR) brachytherapy, electron radiation therapy, image-guided radiation therapy (IGRT), intensity modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), radiopharmaceuticals, stereotactic body radiation therapy (SBRT), stereotactic radiosurgery (SRS), *SpaceOARâ„¢, Prostate Brachytherapy.

content.biography:
Omar Kahaly, MD is a cardiac electrophysiologist. Cardiac electrophysiology is a field within cardiology that specializes in heart conditions that cause arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation. The specialty also encompasses heart rhythm disorders that requires pacemakers and defibrillators.

Dr. Kahaly is board-certified in clinical cardiac electrophysiology, cardiovascular disease, and internal medicine.

Conditions treated: Syncope, atrial fibrillation, pacemakers, cardiac arrhythmias, and defibrillators.

Procedures/treatments performed: Heart ablations, sudden cardiac arrest, palpitations, Watchman implantation, and pacemaker/defibrillator extraction.

More about me: Dr. Kahaly grew up in Toledo, Ohio and considers it his mission to help bring the best healthcare to the community that raised him. At ProMedica, he is active in cutting-edge clinical research.

content.biography:
Adil Karamali, MD, FACC is a cardiologist. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Dr. Karamali is board-certified in internal medicine and critical care.

Care philosophy: Dr. Karamaliâ€™s main goal is to keep a patientâ€™s heart healthy. Above all, each patient must be treated as a family member with compassion and empathy. Words of wisdom from a mentor are still with him to this day: Patient First.

Clinical interests: More than the practice of general cardiology, he takes pride in his abilities as an interventional cardiologist. Additionally, Dr. Karamali has a keen interest in the care of oncology patients as it pertains to their cardiac risk secondary to their underlying malignancy.

Conditions treated: Atrial fibrillation, congestive heart failure, acute coronary syndrome, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, cardiac catheterization, transesophageal echocardiography, and cardioversion.

More about me: Dr. Karamali met his wife in college when he was a student at Boston College. She was the only one he dated there.

ProMedica Cardiothoracic Surgeon Dr. Michael Moront is a classmate of his from college.

Dr. Karamali was on the Olympic team for Pakistan for swimming, but he emigrated to the United States before he could compete. His father was in the 1948 Olympics for swimming for Pakistan.

He is an avid golfer, but is not sure what he does on the course can be called â€œgolfâ€.

Jobst Vascular Institute is a world-renowned vascular center that provides patients access to comprehensive vascular services including: vascular testing, vascular rehabilitation, wound care, anticoagulation care, clinical trials, and specialized treatment for varicose and spider veins.

The physicians of ProMedica Physicians Jobst Vascular and Jobst Vascular Institute all are board certified in vascular disease. With 15 office locations across northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan, we are committed to providing our patients and their families with high quality, innovative, and patient-centered care.

More about Gregory Kasper MD, FACS

Dr. Kasper has been practicing vascular surgery in Toledo for more than 15 years. In 2015, Dr. Kasper was named president and chief medical officer of Jobst Vascular Institute.

Dr. Kasper was born and raised in Toledo and returned after completing his medical training. Dr. Kasper and his wife, Christina, have three sons. Both Dr. and Mrs. Kasper are active in charitable work and enjoy travel and golfing.

content.biography:
Eric Kielhorn, MD, is board-certified by the American Board of Radiology. He puts the interests of his patients first and participates in a multidisciplinary team approach that includes not just radiation treatment, but education and emotional support in a warm, healing environment. Dr. Kielhorn believes the best patient care is delivered when the patient and physician have a good relationship, and the physician understands the goals and needs of the patient.

Dr. Kielhorn and the ProMedica Physicians Radiation Oncology team provide exceptional cancer care close to home, with facilities located in Sylvania, Maumee, and Fremont, Ohio and Adrian and Monroe, Michigan. Services also include holistic treatment, social work, and dietary.

State-of-the-art diagnostic tests, treatments and supportive therapies: 3-D conformal radiation therapy, High Dose Rate (HDR) brachytherapy, electron radiation therapy, image-guided radiation therapy (IGRT), intensity modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), radiopharmaceuticals, stereotactic body radiation therapy (SBRT), stereotactic radiosurgery (SRS), SpaceOARâ„¢, Prostate Brachytherapy.

content.biography:
Roger Kruse, MD is board certified in family medicine and sports medicine. He is a member of ProMedica Physicians and brings expertise in regenerative medicine to the Toledo area. He is committed to improving the quality of life for athletes and others who may be living with chronic joint pain, osteoarthritis, tendonitis, torn ligaments or knee, hip, shoulder, back or ankle pain. Dr. Kruse utilizes cutting edge medicine as a non-surgical option to treat patients. Regenerative medicine, which adds an additional element to his current 25-year practice, offers advanced procedures and new techniques. 

Dr. Kruse has been incorporating and practicing regenerative medicine for over 13 years with overwhelming success. He uses advanced procedures like ultrasound and fluoroscopy to guide his PRP and ortho biologic injections. This has drawn international attention and patients have traveled from many countries around the world for treatment.

Nationally and internationally known for his leadership in sports medicine and musculoskeletal medicine, Dr Kruse is committed to utilizing cutting edge regenerative medicine giving patients an alternative to surgery. Dr. Kruseâ€™s extensive resume includes serving as a team physician for three Olympic games (1994 Norway and 1996 Atlanta). He ultimately served as the head physician for the entire United States Olympic Team in Nagano, Japan in 1998. Dr. Kruse is the founder and program director of the University of Toledo Primary Care Sports Medicine Fellowship. Over 29 years the program has successfully graduated over 73 sports medicine physicians that practice throughout the United States. As head physician for the University of Toledo, he oversees all 17 sports and the care of all the athletes.

Dr. Kruse is a Clinical Professor at the University of Toledo College of Medicine and is an Assistant Clinical Professor at the Michigan State University College of Medicine. Nationally, Dr. Kruse has served on the NCAA Committee for Competitive Safeguards and Medical Aspects of Sports from 2014 â€“ 2018. During that time, he was the Chairman of Drug Testing of all NCAA sports. He has also served as a Drug Crew Chief on many international events including the Boston and New York Marathons.

content.biography:
Roger Kucway, MD, is board-certified by the American Board of Radiology. He puts the interests of his patients first and participates in a multidisciplinary team approach that includes not just radiation treatment, but education and emotional support in a warm, healing environment. Dr. Kucway believes the best patient care is delivered when the patient and physician have a good relationship, and the physician understands the goals and needs of the patient.

Dr. Kucway and the ProMedica Physicians Radiation Oncology team provide exceptional cancer care close to home, with facilities located in Sylvania, Maumee, and Fremont, Ohio and Adrian and Monroe, Michigan. Services also include holistic treatment, social work, and dietary.

State-of-the-art diagnostic tests, treatments and supportive therapies: 3-D conformal radiation therapy, High Dose Rate (HDR) brachytherapy, electron radiation therapy, image-guided radiation therapy (IGRT), intensity modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), radiopharmaceuticals, stereotactic body radiation therapy (SBRT), stereotactic radiosurgery (SRS), *SpaceOARâ„¢, Prostate Brachytherapy.

content.biography:
Physical medicine is a branch of medicine that aims to enhance and restore functional ability of activities of daily living and quality of life to people with physical impairments or disabilities affecting the spine, nerves, bones, joints, ligaments, muscles and tendons.

Jill Kunisch, CNP attended renowned Dr. Thomas Clarkâ€™s cadaver course for hands-on training and ultrasound-guided musculoskeletal injections. She has ongoing collaboration with three well-established, certified physical medicine and rehabilitation physicians and is training with a well-established orthopedic surgeon in diagnosing and treating hip and knee osteoarthritis.

Jill's care philosophy is working cooperatively with her patients in developing a patient centered and evidence based plan of care starting with conservative treatment options and adjusting as appropriate in order to improve her patientâ€™s overall quality of life, function and well-being. There is a strong focus on patient and family education, offering a better understanding of the patient's condition and appropriate treatment options available to them.

Jill states she is a friend of Jesus, mother and wife. She loves animals, the outdoors and being active and leading a healthy lifestyle.
