content.biography:
Danine has been a Registered Nurse within the Psychiatric Specialty for over 35+ years of her career. She continued her education to become a Nurse Practitioner for 20+ of those years, to care for people seeking improvement in their own mental health. As our lives change, stressors occur, and things around us evolve, Danineâ€™s philosophy is to treat others the way she would like herself and her family to be treated for mental health issues. We are human beings and the brain is an organ that we cannot live without and requires some special care just as other organs require.

Her clinical interests have varied since each person presents a unique opportunity to meet their needs which involves other conditions, environment, strengths, and willingness to work hard and accept the help of a team of recommended resources. Many people have pain issues, sleep concerns, loneliness to be heard, reassurance of being human and not crazy, and too many more conditions to be named. Danine continues reading the latest research and science publications of new medications, treatments, combined treatments, and discusses with others via networks of associations with other national and international nurse practitioners and psychiatrists.

She enjoys what she does, enjoys meeting the many people she has met throughout her career and looks forward to meeting many new people going forward. Danine recognizes she do not have all the answers, not even close, but she appreciates the hard work each person has done between appointments and has taken on any hurdles or bumps along the way to improving their mental health to enjoy the moment and plan their future. Each person that reaches their individual optimum mental health becomes a success that brings smiles, laughter, and just conversation of hard work that brightens their life and future!

Family medicine is a specialty that provides care to people of every age group. Xiaxi Layton, MD is very much a generalist, so family medicine was a great fit. I enjoy listening to my patient's stories, and getting to work with them on treatment options that would help them live their best lives. 


Having been trained in public health, Dr. Layton is an advocate in disease prevention and health education. She offers many preventative services from well child visits to a variety of cancer screenings. 


Dr. Layton was locally trained at UTMC, and completed residency at ProMedica Monroe Family Medicine Residency where she was awarded The Dana Roberts Founders Award upon graduation for emulating the caring and compassionate nature of family medicine. 


Dr. Layton would like her patients to know that she will always strive to be accessible. Whether it is struggling with smoking cessation or weight loss, she and her staff will be there to help and guide patients every step of the way.

content.biography:
Jack Li, MD, MBA, FACC is a cardiac electrophysiologist. Cardiac electrophysiology is a field within cardiology that specializes in heart conditions that cause arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation. The specialty also encompasses heart rhythm disorders that require pacemakers and defibrillators.

Dr. Li is board-certified in clinical cardiac electrophysiology, cardiovascular disease, and internal medicine.

Philosophy of care: He believes in providing care that is centered around the patient. After each visit, his hope is that his patients fully understand their arrhythmic issues and through shared decision making, enact a plan of care personally tailored to their needs.

Conditions treated: Dr. Li specializes in the full range of care for heart rhythm issues and cardiac devices. He is experienced in complex arrhythmic management including ablations for atrial fibrillation, supraventricular tachycardias, and ventricular tachycardias. He also provides comprehensive management of implantable cardiac devices such as defibrillators, pacemakers, and cardiac resynchronization therapy.

Procedures/treatments performed: Cardiac implantable device management. including pacemakers, defibrillators and cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT) device, Watchman implantable device for left atrial appendage occlusion, lead management and extractions, familial arrhythmia syndromes including arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, Brugada syndrome, hypertrophic cardiomyopathy and long QT syndrome, and postural orthostatic tachycardia syndrome (POTS).

More about me: Dr. Li grew up in Iowa and loves to cheer on the University of Michigan - Go Blue! He is married to a wonderful partner who works as a pediatric nurse practitioner (she cheers for LSU) and is the father to a wonderful 6-year-old girl with one more on the way. He lives in Sylvania and enjoys attending county fairs, finding the best ice cream, and traveling.

title: Rosie Li MD - Obstetrics - Perrysburg, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Rosie Li MD
content.location: ProMedica Physicians Obstetrics | Gynecology - Levis Commons
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Physicians Obstetrics | Gynecology - Levis Commons

content.biography:
Rosie Li, MD is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN).

Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.

Care philosophy: Communication is at the center of Dr. Li's care philosophy. She believes that effective communication between the provider and the patient and the provider and other medical team specialties or team members is important for providing complete patient care. She wants the patient to feel like they had the opportunity to voice their concerns and ask all the questions. Additionally, she believes it is important to update all members who are involved in a particular patient's care to be on the same page to decrease miscommunication.

Conditions treated: Routine and high-risk pregnancy, menopause, abnormal menstrual bleeding, painful periods, contraception, endometriosis, fibroids, sexual health.

Procedures performed: Minimally-invasive hysterectomy, endometrial ablation, removal of fallopian tubes (salpingectomy), removal of ovaries (oophorectomy), fibroid removal (myomectomy)

More about me: Dr. Li grew up in three different countries and finally settled in Baltimore. She was drawn to the Midwest after attending University of Michigan and decided to come back for medical school after completing graduate school. She and her husband settled in Toledo, Ohio after completing her OB/GYN residency.

content.biography:
As a doctor of optometry, Preston Linley, OD examines, diagnoses, treats and manages diseases and disorders of the eyes. Optometric physicians also prescribe medications, low vision rehabilitation, vision therapy, spectacle lenses, contact lenses and perform certain surgical procedures. Comprehensive eye exams with a doctor of optometry are an important for overall health and well-being, as eye exams help detect more than 270 serious health conditions, including diabetes, high blood pressure, autoimmune disorders and cancers.

The philosophy of care that Dr. Linley follows is treating his patients as family members. He has also participated in mission trips to provide eye care around the world. 


Dr. Linley has been recognized by numerous awards and is a member of several associations including:

content.biography:
Life is full of surprises for all of us â€“ sometimes good, sometimes bad, and oftentimes overwhelming. It is important for us to have people around us, cheering us on when we are doing well, keeping us positive when we feel like things are falling apart, and helping us sort things out when we are feeling lost and unsure of where to go next. Sometimes we just feel we have a lack of support or that things are so difficult that we need professional help.

As a Licensed Master Social Worker and member of the Academy of Certified Social Workers, Douglas Lovell has worked directly with individuals in psychotherapy treatment for over 10 years assisting them in being more positive, feeling more satisfied, and bettering themselves. Using empathy and compassion combined with the most recent evidence-based therapeutic techniques, he offers patients of all ages the opportunity to make positive lifelong changes.

Christina Lucas-Vougiouklakis, DO is currently the medical director for ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital Family Medicine Residency program and is also the director of osteopathic education.

Dr. Lucas-Vougiouklakis has been practicing osteopathic family medicine since 2011 and is also board certified lifestyle medicine which focuses on primary prevention through diet, exercise, and whole food plant based nutrition. She loves education and has taught students and residents since 2011.

Dr. Lucas-Vougiouklakis founded a nonprofit organization called Hellenic Healthcare Professionals of Michigan whose mission is to empower, unite and connect healthcare providers of Greek ethnicity with the communities in which they serve.

Her other interests include spending time with her family, singing, playing the piano and traveling abroad. Dr. Lucas-Vougiouklakis also enjoys public speaking and educating her community about various topics.

content.biography:
David Macari, MD, is a fellowship-trained hematologist oncologist. He is board-certified in internal medicine, hematology as well as medical oncology.

Hematology is the treatment of both cancerous and noncancerous conditions of the blood ranging from anemias, clotting disorders, bleeding disorders, lymphomas, leukemias, and other bone marrow conditions. Medical oncology involves systemic treatments including targeted therapy, immunotherapy, and chemotherapy to treat cancer.

Dr. Macari's philosophy of care is to provide the best possible standard of care and treatment for all of his  patients and to have excellent communication between the patient, himself and the other specialties involved in the patientâ€™s care.

Dr. Macari is a two-time recipient of the Hematology Oncology Fellowship Research award from Beaumont Hospital.

title: Alisha Marchand CNM - Midwifery - Oregon, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Alisha Marchand CNM
content.location: ProMedica Physicians Obstetrics and Gynecology - Oregon
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Physicians Obstetrics and Gynecology - Oregon

content.biography:
Alisha Marchand, CNM is a certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who provide reproductive primary care and who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions.

Care philosophy: Pregnancy is not a medical condition and should not be treated as such. Pregnancy, labor and delivery are all natural occurrences and it's important to listen to one's body. Alisha believes that medical interventions should be saved for when they are required. She is passionate about treating patients holistically and providing evidence-based education and treatment techniques to ensure the best care.

Clinical interests: Spinning babies

More about me: Alisha has 13 years of experience in labor and delivery, providing support to patients and their families during labor. She believes in making decisions as a team and is supportive of any decisions that women and their family unit make prior to their arrival to labor and delivery. She believes that informed and supportive care is the only care and strives to make all patients and families feel comfortable. She also provides labor support training to staff nurses and other midwives to help decrease the rate of cesarean deliveries.

University of Michigan

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Physicians Health Specialists of Lenawee

content.biography:
Family Medicine provides care for the entire family from birth, throughout adulthood, and into the last stages of life. My care philosophy is centered around my clinical interests and what I believe are the core values of family medicine which is to practice preventative medicine and help patients make life-style changes to prevent disease. It is also about treating a wide spectrum of diseases and being the first line of contact for the healthcare system. In doing this effectively I hope to gain the trust and establish great relationships with my patients.

I grew up in Columbus, OH and went to The University of Toledo College of Medicine and Life Sciences for my Masterâ€™s and Medical Degree. I then completed my residency at St. Joseph Mercy Livingston Family Medicine Residency where I was the Academic Chief Resident in my last year of residency before becoming certified by the American Board of Family Medicine.

Some interesting things that patients may not know about me would be that I have been skydiving before and I was a placekicker for John Carroll University in College. My interests include playing board games, riding bikes, personal finance, and spending time with family.

content.biography:
Renee Mason, MD is a board certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN).

Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.

Clinical interests: Fitness, wellness, preventative care, obesity medicine, weight loss management, and diet, exercise and behavioral changes for treatment of PCOS/infertility and diabetes 

Special certifications: Personal training

More about me: Dr. Mason has seen such a change in medicine in her 26 years of private practice that she was motivated to open a fitness facility and commercial kitchen to promote wellness, healthy eating and movement. She is also a certified personal trainer and yoga instructor.

content.biography:
Ryan Meller, MSN, APRN, FNP-C, is a board-certified family nurse practitioner and has an American Academy of Nurse Practitioner Certification. He puts the interests of his patients first and believes itâ€™s important to provide individualized, patient-focused care.

Born and raised in the Toledo, Ohio area, he and the ProMedica Physicians Radiation Oncology team provide exceptional cancer care close to home, with facilities located in Sylvania, Maumee, and Fremont, Ohio and Adrian and Monroe, Michigan. Services also include holistic treatment, social work, and dietary.

content.biography:
Darla Mitchell, CNM, is a certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with fewer medical interventions. 

As a midwife, Darla Mitchell provides care for women focusing on health, wellness, and prevention. Her goal is to use clinical expertise to empower women through health education and counseling. With this knowledge, they are able to become partners in their own care and to make personal choices which are best for themselves and their families.

She has special interests in adolescent health, lactation support and breast cancer survivorship and has been previously certified as a lactation consultant and as a childbirth educator. She has spent her entire nursing career involved in various aspects of maternal-child care; returning to graduate school to become a midwife once her own children were grown due to her passion for providing comprehensive and compassionate care for women in all stages of life.

content.biography:
Todd Monroe, MD, FACC specializes in cardiology. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions. 

According to Dr. Monroe, cardiology is an everchanging and a strong research-based specialty. Also that evidence based protocols largely dictate treatment and positive patient outcomes.

Dr. Monroe is board certified in internal medicine, cardiology, and interventional cardiology.

Care philosophy: He believes in appropriate aggressiveness and compassionate personalized care. He says his job is to listen to his patients and try to help them achieve optimal health.

Conditions treated: Coronary artery disease, acute myocardial infarction, cardiogenic shock, congestive heart failure, and syncope.

Procedures/treatments performed: Cardiac catheterization, intracoronary stent implantation, intracoronary rotablator and thrombectomy, intra-aortic balloon/ Impella life support, and temporary pacemaker insertion.

More about me: Dr. Monroe is interested in how stress and anxiety play a role in our overall physical health.

His personal interests include family time, scuba diving, golf, travel, trivia, and Kentucky Bourbon.

content.biography:
It is estimated 5-10% of all cancers are due to underlying hereditary causes. When we identify a person that has a hereditary predisposition to develop specific cancers, it allows for medical management tailored to that persons individual risks. It may allow for additional treatment options for oneâ€™s cancer. It is also information that can be shared with family members as they may benefit from genetic counseling and possible testing. As a Genetic Counselor, we are uniquely trained to help families understand this information and work closely with their providers to ensure theyâ€™re receiving the best possible follow-up and screening.

Kelly appreciates many people may be unsure about the genetic counseling and genetic testing process. If you have questions, she encourages you to have an initial consult with a genetic counselor so we may address your questions and educate you regarding the options of genetic testing. Kelly looks forward to talking with you.

content.imgAlt: Hind N Moussa MD MSHI, FACOG
content.name: Hind N Moussa MD MSHI, FACOG
content.location: Maternal-Fetal Medicine at ProMedica Toledo Hospital

primaryLocation.locationName: Maternal-Fetal Medicine at ProMedica Toledo Hospital

content.biography:
Hind Moussa MD, MSHI, FACOG specializes in maternal-fetal medicine. Maternal-fetal medicine is a medical specialty that focuses on the care of women with high-risk pregnancies or pregnancy complications. The health of the mother and the fetus are monitored closely during pregnancy. 

Care philosophy: As a maternal-fetal medicine specialist, Dr. Moussa believes that it is her honor and privilege to be there during some of the most exciting yet scariest moments a family may face. From her understanding of the journey those families go through stems her philosophy of the importance of being â€œpresentâ€ for her patients during those times. She believes that her ability to be there and to provide support can have a long-lasting impact.

Clinical interests: Dr. Moussa's clinical interests include maternal medical complications during pregnancy, preterm birth and its prevention, as well as quality and safety improvement. On the fetal side, she is interested in fetal diagnosis and fetal neurodevelopment. During her fellowship training she focused her research on the fetal origins of autism etiology in relation to the maternal uterine environment, for which she received the Society for Maternal-Fetal Medicine excellence in research award. 

More about me: Dr. Moussa is family oriented and enjoys spending time with her daughter, and her niece and nephews. She is multilingual and fluent in Arabic, French and English. She enjoys community outreach both professionally and socially.

content.biography:
Rachel has been in health care for over 20 years. She started out as a nursing assistant and home health aide at age 17. Completing her bachelor's degree at the University of Texas at Arlington, Rachel went on to earn her masterâ€™s degree at Walden University.  She also holds certifications in Pediatric Advanced Life Support (PALS), Advanced Cardiovascular Life Support (ACLS) and Basic Life Support (BLS).

She has worked for the majority of her career as an ICU nurse as well as acute dialysis nurse. Rachel began her acute care nurse practitioner career at Jobst Vascular Institute and then transitioned to ProMedica Physicians Hepatobiliary, Pancreas and Endocrine Surgery.  She recently returned to Jobst Vascular Institute.  

Rachel has three daughters, a son-in-law and a grandson, who is the light of her life.  She enjoys sports, cooking and being outdoors.

title: Rachel Mutchler PA-C - Gastroenterology - Sylvania, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Rachel Mutchler PA-C
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography: Rachel is a proud graduate of The Ohio State University with a major in Nutrition. She was a registered dietitian for several years and obtained the Certified Nutrition Support Dietitian credential, allowing her to specialize in nutrition support therapies in critically ill patients. She worked at the Cleveland Clinic, Sinai Hospital of Baltimore and the University of Michigan Hospital prior to pursuing an advanced degree. Rachel was accepted into the Physician Assistant program at the University of Toledo Medical College in 2008, graduating with her Masters of Science in Biomedical Sciences in 2010. She worked for 3 years in the emergency departments of ProMedica Toledo and ProMedica Flower Hospital as well as Mercy St. Anneâ€™s. In 2014, she transitioned to ProMedica Digestive Healthcare to better marry her love of nutrition and medicine. After 6 years of caring for her patients, Rachel accepted an opportunity to become a medical educator for Inflammatory Bowel Diseases; educating physicians, advanced practice providers, nurses, and medical assistants.

content.biography:
Amanda Nuckols, APRN-CNP, is a hematology/oncology nurse practitioner and focuses on adult patients. Hematology / Oncology is a medical specialization in the diagnosis and treatment of both blood diseases (hematology) and cancers (oncology).

Care Philosophy: Amanda believes in patient-centered care. This care may encompass the patient's family as well, especially in those patients who are navigating a cancer journey. She aims to provide care that is at the knowledge level of the patient so that each patient understands their diagnosis, treatment option(s), and an understanding of the treatment they have chosen. Amanda feels as though this allows them to make informed decisions about their care. Her goal is for her patients to feel supported while under her care.

Special Certifications: Oncology Certified Nurse, Clinical Nurse Leader

More about Amanda: Amanda was born and raised in northwest Ohio and is is a three-time graduate of the University of Toledo. In her spare time, she enjoys traveling and particularly enjoys international travel. Amanda has spent time in Okinawa, Japan, Spain, and Australia.

content.name: Cynthia R Okin MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationAddress:
660 Beaver Creek Circle
Suite 200

content.biography:
Cynthia Okin, MD is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN).

Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.

Care philosophy: Dr. Okin believes in listening to the patient and treating the individual. In the OB/GYN specialty, she has the privilege of knowing her patients for many years.

Clinical interests: Pregnancy care, polycystic ovarian syndrome or menstrual irregularities and peri-menopause.

Special certifications: Fellow American College of OBGYN and Member of North American Menopause Society

More about me: Dr. Okin is a University of Michigan graduate, but lives in a divided household. Her husband is an Ohio State fan. One of her boys went to Ohio State and another went to the University of Michigan. Her youngest son is still at home. When she is not working, she loves watching her kids play sports. She enjoys many outdoor activities and loves to travel.

content.biography:
Matthew Olzak APRN-CNP, is a hematology oncology nurse practitioner. Hematology oncology involves the diagnosis and treatment of cancers of the blood and cancerous blood disorders. Hematologist oncology providers also help patients manage the symptoms of these diseases and treat any tumors that result from them.

Matthew strives to provide patient care that is clear, concise, and a comfort to his patients and their families. Making sure a patient understands what their condition is and providing them their treatment options aides the patient with making an informed decision about their care. He believes any patient that is battling a condition as serious as cancer deserves a health care team that is compassionate yet precise and this is the type of care and service provided by Matthew and his colleagues.

title: ProMedica Physicians Cardiology

content.name: Carson Oostra MD, MBA
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Carson Oostra, MD, MBA, is a cardiologist. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Dr. Oostra is board-certified in echocardiography, nuclear cardiology and internal medicine.

Care philosophy: He encourages his patients to be their biggest advocate when it comes to their overall health. He feels that patients need to understand their conditions, know their medications and take an active role. Dr. Oostra strives to treat every patient with the same dedication as he would for a member of his family.

Clinical interests: He has an interest in valvular heart disease, non-invasive cardiology, transesophageal echocardiography and imaging for patients considered for structural heart interventions.

Conditions treated: Valvular (structural) heart disease, coronary artery disease, hypertrophic cardiomyopathy and preventive heart disease with lifestyle modifications through diet and exercise.

Procedures performed: Echocardiography, transesophageal echocardiography, nuclear cardiology and stress testing.

More about me: Dr. Oostra grew up in Toledo, Ohio, and is proud to provide heart care in his community. He lives in the area with his wife and son and enjoys traveling and running.
education:

content.biography:
Anthony Palmer, MD, originally from Michigan, is a pediatric hematologist/oncologist. Pediatric Hematology / Oncology is a medical specialization in the diagnosis and treatment of both blood diseases (hematology) and cancers (oncology) in children. As a member of the Children's Oncology Group (COG), Dr. Palmer has an interest in providing access, whenever possible, to clinical trials for his patients.

Care philosophy: To involve each patient's family as a key part of the medical team. No single person can cure cancer in a child. It takes many supporting members from our comprehensive care team.

Conditions treated: All childhood and young adults cancers including: acute and chronic leukemia, lymphomas, bone tumors, sarcomas, brain tumors, germ cell tumors, Wilms tumors, neuroblastoma, liver tumors. Additional conditions include ITP, aplastic anemia, neutropenia and anemia.

Procedures performed: Lumbar punctures (spinal tap), bone marrow biopsy and aspirate.

content.biography:
Jaydutt Patel, MD, is a cardiac electrophysiologist. Cardiac electrophysiology is a field within cardiology that specializes in heart conditions that cause arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation. The specialty also encompasses heart rhythm disorders that require pacemakers and defibrillators.

Care philosophy: Dr. Patel believes that when he is with a patient, they are the center of his universe. He says that his first duty is to evaluate a patient. Second, to come up with his assessment and provide the plan based on science and data. And third, he does his best to provide recommendations with clarity, empathy and compassion.

Conditions treated: Atrial fibrillation, atrial flutter, Supraventricular tachycardia (SVT), ventricular tachycardia (VT), tachy-brady arrhythmias, and congestive heart failure. 

Procedures performed: Catheter ablation, implantable defibrillators, implantable pacemakers, lead extraction, and watchman.  

More about me: Dr. Patel relocated to the Toledo, Ohio area with his wife and three children after practicing in Pennsylvania for 10 years.

Outside of work, he likes to spend quality time with his family and read non-fiction books. He also enjoys practicing his religion.

content.biography:
Anita Patibandla, MD is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB-GYN).

Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born.

Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.

Care philosophy: Dr. Patibandla strongly believes that women are the backbone of their family unit and communities, and when equipped with information and education about their conditions and health, they are fully capable of making the best decisions for the health and well-being of both themselves and their families. She is very passionate about providing her patients with education and learning from them.

Procedures performed: Loop Electrosurgical Excision Procedure (LOOP)

More about me: Dr. Patibandla is married with three children. She was a former all-American volleyball/lacrosse player at Johns Hopkins University from1994-1998.

title: Taylor Patterson CNP - Cardiothoracic Surgery - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Taylor Patterson CNP
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Taylor Patterson, CNP, is a certified nurse practitioner who specializes in cardiothoracic surgery. Cardiothoracic surgery focuses on surgical problems related to the heart and chest cavity.

Care philosophy: Taylor believes in treating every patient equally with evidence-based practices and sincere compassion. She also believes that you can learn a lot from your patients by taking the time to sit down and listen to them.

Conditions treated: Aortic valve disease, empyema, endocarditis, lung cancer/nodules, mitral valve disease, pneumothorax, and tricuspid valve disease.

More about me: As a cardiothoracic nurse practitioner, Taylor is primarily in charge of the care of post-op patients on the intermediate cardiac stepdown floor, including daily medication adjustments and discharge orders. She also sees patients for their follow-up appointments in the office.

She started her nursing career in the heart and vascular intensive care unit (HVSICU) taking care of post-op patients. After working there for five years, she was hired as a nurse practitioner with ProMedica Physicians Cardiothoracic Surgeons.

Taylor also has sisters in the medical field. Her older sister is a primary care provider (PCP) and her younger sister is a dermatologist.

content.biography:
Timothy Phelan, MD is a cardiac electrophysiologist. Cardiac electrophysiology is a field within cardiology that specializes in heart conditions that cause arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation. The specialty also encompasses heart rhythm disorders that requires pacemakers and defibrillators.

Dr. Phelan is board-certified in clinical cardiac electrophysiology, cardiovascular disease, and internal medicine.

Care philosophy: He believes in taking time to know his patients and to understand what is important to them. He also believes that not every treatment is the right choice for every patient.

Conditions treated: Atrial fibrillation, ventricular tachycardia (VT), supraventricular tachycardia (SVT), and cardiomyopathy.

Procedures/treatments performed: Cardiac ablations, pacemaker insertion, implantable cardioverter-defibrillator insertion, and cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT/biventricular devices). 

More about me: His personal career interests include complex ablations of both atrial and ventricular arrhythmias. In addition, he often participates in various multi-center research trials designed to improve future treatments for patients.

Dr. Phelan is originally from Baltimore, Maryland where most of his early medical education took place. He met his wife while they both were pursuing their medical training in Richmond, Virginia. He and his wife have both been practicing in the Toledo area since 2017.

content.biography:
Sarah Puckett, DO is a doctor of osteopathic medicine specializing in obstetrics/gynecology.

Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.

Care philosophy: Dr. Puckett believes that every person should be an active participant in their health. Her job is to help prevent and identify health problems then explain all the possible risks, benefits, and alternatives of treatment options. Then, she and her patients can work together to decide what treatment is best for them.

More about me: Dr. Puckett chose obstetrics and gynecology because of the wide variety within the narrow focus of womenâ€™s health. She cares for women throughout their lifetime. She can educate, counsel and help women in the office setting. She becomes part of their family story when caring for them during pregnancy and delivery and gets to share in one of lifeâ€™s happiest moments. She also finds it rewarding to perform surgery using the latest minimally invasive techniques and treatments to achieve the best outcomes for her patients.

title: William J Rachwal MD, FACS - Cardiothoracic Surgery - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: William J Rachwal MD, FACS
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Dr. William Rachwal is board-certified in cardiac and thoracic surgery. His clinical interests include robotic thoracic surgery and he's had advanced training to perfect his robotic surgery skills. In addition to treating a wide variety of heart-related diseases and conditions, Dr. Rachwal also provides ECMO (extracorporeal membrane oxygenation) support to patients experiencing shock and respiratory failure.

Dr. Rachwal's care philosophy is to provide the safest, most effective surgical care for patients with cardiac and thoracic diseases.

He and his fellow cardiothoracic surgeons strive to make national level care available to patients in the NW Ohio and SE Michigan so that they do not have to travel hours away from their families to receive top-notch treatment. In fact, the quality of care, outcomes and treatment they offer are consistently ranked among the top in the country by credible rating agencies and professional and trade organizations like The Society for Thoracic Surgeons.

Dr. Rachwal is a clinical assistant professor at The University of Toledo, College of Medicine and Life Sciences.

content.biography:
P. Kasi Ramanathan, MD, FACC, is an interventional cardiologist. Interventional cardiology is a subspecialty of cardiology that focuses on treating cardiovascular disease through catheter-based treatments.

Dr. Ramanathan is board-certified in interventional cardiology, cardiovascular medicine, nuclear cardiology, and internal medicine. He also has certifications in peripheral vascular interventions, cardiovascular CT, nuclear cardiology, and echocardiography. And, he is trained and certified in implanting transcatheter aortic valves, transcatheter mitral clips, left atrial appendage occlusion devices, and PFO and ASD closures.

Care philosophy: He believes in taking care of each patient as if they are part of his family.

Procedures/treatments performed: Interventional and structural heart procedures, cardiac catheterization, percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI), high risk PCI, STEMI care, and percutaneous valvular intervention.

More about me: Dr. Ramanathanâ€™s interest in cardiology stems from his family members having heart disease. He enjoys cardiology because he is constantly learning new things.

In addition to clinical cardiology, he enjoys working on medical devices to improve patient care. He performs interventional and structural heart procedures in the cath lab.

Lauren Regueyra, MD, is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN). 

Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate. 

Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. 

More about me: Dr. Regueyra grew up in the Cincinnati, Ohio area. she returned to Toledo after spending the past several years living and working in Kansas City. In her free time, she enjoys spending time with her husband and dog, cooking, being outdoors and reading.

conditionsProcedures: Arthritis of the foot and ankle
content.biography:
Matthew M. Reiner, DPM, is a fellowship trained foot and ankle specialist. He is board certified in foot and ankle surgery by the American Board of Foot and Ankle Surgery. He completed his fellowship at the Northern Ohio Foot and Ankle Foundation in association with Orthopedic Associates of Lake County in Concord, Ohio. He completed his residency at St. Vincent Charity Medical Center, Cleveland, Ohio where he served as chief resident.

Before graduating with his medical degree from the Kent State University College of Podiatric Medicine, he received the Wally Wiseman Surgical Excellence Award for Proficiency and Demonstrated Excellence in Podiatric Surgery. He also received the William F. Todd Award for Excellence in General Medicine. 

Dr. Reiner has specialized training in revision and reconstructive foot and ankle surgery, flatfoot correction, trauma of the foot and ankle, total ankle replacement surgery, and arthroscopic surgery of the ankle. He takes pride in exhausting non-surgical options before proceeding to surgical intervention and will devise a treatment plan based on your needs and lifestyle.

content.biography:
Kendall Reiter, LPCC, specializes in working with children and adolescents who struggle with social, emotional, and behavioral challenges throughout daily life. Some of her focus areas are issues related to trauma, mood disorders, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), school stressors, anger management, and family and peer relationships.
Kendall has experience working with children in different settings, including school and group settings.

Kendall obtained a masterâ€™s degree from the University of Toledo in clinical mental health counseling. Through her education and experience, she has established techniques to help provide a warm and inviting atmosphere for individuals to feel comfortable and safe. Kendall believes that developing a positive therapeutic relationship is key to the success of counseling for children and adolescents. Utilizing a number of evidence-based treatments such as cognitive-behavioral therapy, narrative therapy, motivational interviewing, play therapy, and art therapy, Kendall helps children and adolescents accomplish their goals.

She has a passion for traveling and enjoys painting and drawing, taking long walks with her dog, and spending time with friends and family.

title: Christopher J Riordan MD, FACS - Cardiothoracic Surgery - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Christopher J Riordan MD, FACS
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Dr. Chris Riordan is board-certified in thoracic surgery and general surgery. As a cardiothoracic surgeon, he treats a broad spectrum of diseases and conditions involving the heart. Many of the heart issues, tend to be structural or mechanical problems, such as blockages in the coronaries.

Dr. Riordan and his fellow cardiothoracic surgeons strive to make national level care available to patients in the NW Ohio and SE Michigan so that they do not have to travel hours away from their families to receive top-notch treatment. In fact, the quality of care, outcomes and treatment they offer are consistently ranked among the top in the country by credible rating agencies and professional and trade organizations like The Society for Thoracic Surgeons.

Dr. Riordan has been particularly interested in offering the full range of minimally-invasive approaches to patients. He has trained at some of the larger volume heart centers in the country and was also fortunate enough to spend a year in the lab working on projects including development of a newer version of a total artificial heart.

In addition to being a cardiothoracic surgeon, Dr. Riordan also a clinical assistant professor at The University of Toledo, College of Medicine and Life Sciences.
education:

During his physician assistant education, Jason pursued clinical rotations to help tailor his studies towards the field of orthopedics. He has worked and trained with Dr. Andrew Assenmacher at ProMedica for the last four years.

Jason's care philosophy centers on a team approach to orthopedics in order to safely and effectively return patients to the activities they enjoy.

Coming from an athletic training background, he enjoys working with athletes and helping them return to peak performance following an injury.

Jayne Roth, CNM is a certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who provide reproductive primary care and who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions.

More about me: Jayne has worked in obstetrics for over 30 years. Her passion is to see women and families have healthy babies and positive pregnancy and birth experiences. Her desire is for patients and families to have compassionate caregivers who provide the best care even in less than perfect situations. Her motivation is to help other healthcare providers be better caregivers to patients. She is intrigued by high risk pregnancies, challenged by complications, and amazed that with excellent care great outcomes can occur.

content.biography:
Steven Rubin, MD, is fellowship-trained from the University of Chicago Center for Radiation Therapy and is board-certified by the American Board of Radiology. He puts the interests of his patients first and participates in a multidisciplinary team approach that includes not just radiation treatment, but education and emotional support in a warm, healing environment. Dr. Rubin believes the best patient care is delivered when the patient and physician have a good relationship, and the physician understands the goals and needs of the patient.

Dr. Rubin and the ProMedica Physicians Radiation Oncology team provide exceptional cancer care close to home, with facilities located in Sylvania, Maumee, and Fremont, Ohio and Adrian and Monroe, Michigan. Services also include holistic treatment, social work, and dietary.

State-of-the-art diagnostic tests, treatments and supportive therapies: 3-D conformal radiation therapy, High Dose Rate (HDR) brachytherapy, electron radiation therapy, image-guided radiation therapy (IGRT), intensity modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), radiopharmaceuticals, stereotactic body radiation therapy (SBRT), stereotactic radiosurgery (SRS), *SpaceOARâ„¢, Prostate Brachytherapy.  

*"SpaceOARâ„¢ Hydrogel is a trademark of Boston Scientific Corporation or its affiliates."

content.biography:
Jennifer R. Ruddy, MD specializes in pediatric pulmonary medicine and is board certified in pediatrics and pediatric pulmonology. Pediatric pulmonary medicine is a specialty that helps children who have problems with breathing. The goal of pulmonary medicine is preventing, diagnosing, and treating diseases of the lung.

More about me: Dr. Ruddy is the co-director of the Cystic Fibrosis Center at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Childrenâ€™s Hospital as well as a clinical associate professor of pediatrics at the University of Toledo College of Medicine. Dr. Ruddy graduated from Ohio State University College of Medicine and Public Health. She completed pediatric residency at Akron Childrenâ€™s Hospital in Akron, Ohio and then completed pediatric pulmonary fellowship at Rainbow Babies & Childrenâ€™s Hospital in Cleveland, Ohio. After fellowship, she practiced pediatric pulmonology at Seattle Childrenâ€™s Hospital in Seattle, Washington until moving back to Ohio in 2012.
   

Care Philosophy: Dr. Ruddy's care philosophy is to provide the highest quality care for children by working together as a team with the child and their family. Because each child is unique, it is important to get to know each patient well so that treatment can be based on individual needs as much as possible. She strives to provide thorough evaluation and management and provide detailed education and explanation of the condition. She encourages patients and families to ask questions, and believes that all questions are good questions. She feels that routine follow up visits are very important for many pediatric pulmonary conditions. Her goal is that by working as a team with patients and their families to provide the best care possible, they will be able to lead their lives to the fullest.

content.biography:
Jobst Vascular Institute is a world-renowned vascular center that provides patients access to comprehensive vascular services including: vascular testing, vascular rehabilitation, wound care, anticoagulation care, clinical trials, and specialized treatment for varicose and spider veins.

The physicians of ProMedica Physicians Jobst Vascular and Jobst Vascular Institute all are board certified in vascular disease. With 15 office locations across northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan, we are committed to providing our patients and their families with high quality, innovative, and patient-centered care.

More about Todd E. Russell MD, FACS

Dr. Russell is board-certified in vascular surgery. He currently serves as a faculty member of the Jobst Vascular Fellowship Program at ProMedica Toledo Hospital.

He serves as the Carotid Division Director and participates in clinical research for a variety of vascular conditions. Outside of work,  he is an outdoorsman and enjoys golf.

Dr. Saste is fellowship-trained and board-certified in hematology and oncology. He is also board-certified by the American Board of Internal Medicine.

He treats all types of blood and organ cancers by practicing personalized cancer care utilizing chemotherapy, immunotherapy and targeted treatments. 

Dr. Saste's care philosophy is to offer the most recent advances and innovative cancer care to his patients. He liaises with oncology peers at national and international institutions and applies evidence-based practice principles, helping to enhance treatment results for his patients.

content.biography: Melissa Schlotterer holds a masterâ€™s degree in Clinical Psychology, Applied Behavior Analysis, from The Chicago School of Professional Psychology and a bachelorâ€™s degree in Education from Kent State University. Melissa is a Board Certified Behavior Analyst with 20 years of experience teaching and supervising programs for children with autism in a variety of settings throughout Ohio, Washington D.C., and Chicago. After spending many years supervising school and home based behavioral programs in Chicago, Melissa began working for the ProMedica Finnegan Family Autism Center in 2013 and is currently the Director of Autism Programs and Services. Melissa has presented on topics related to autism and other developmental disabilities at national conferences and within different communities. Her thesis research is published in the journal, Behavioral Interventions. Melissa is originally from North West Ohio and is very passionate about being an integral part of ensuring all children within this community have access to the highest quality of services to enhance growth and learning. Melissa and her husband live in Port Clinton with their two young children. Melissa enjoys spending time with her family and friends and taking advantage of everything living on the lake has to offer.

content.biography:
It is estimated 5-10% of all cancers are due to underlying hereditary causes. When we identify a person that has a hereditary predisposition to develop specific cancers, it allows for medical management tailored to that person's individual risks. It may allow for additional treatment options for oneâ€™s cancer. It is also information that can be shared with family members as they may benefit from genetic counseling and possible testing. 

As a Genetic Counselor, we are uniquely trained to help families understand this information and work closely with their providers to ensure theyâ€™re receiving the best possible follow-up and screening.  Rachel appreciates many people may be unsure about the genetic counseling and genetic testing process. If you have questions, she encourages you to have an initial consult with a genetic counselor so that we may address your questions and provide education regarding the options of genetic testing. Rachel looks forward to talking with you.

content.biography:
Sonyoung Seo-Patel, MD is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN).

Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.

Care philosophy: All patients need to be heard. Dr. Seo-Patel does her very best to work with her patients to provide the care and management plan that best suits their needs and goals. She feels that longitudinal care is important. She wants to get to know her patients so that they both feel comfortable with each other especially when tackling very personal issues. The OB/GYN profession deals with very sensitive parts of the body, and she want her patients to feel respected and comfortable.

More about me: Dr. Seo-Patel was raised in New York City, but her training took her all over the country. She believes this provides her a unique and diverse perspective on patient care and also cultural sensitivity.

content.biography:
Joseph Sferra, MD is currently Professor and Chair, Department of Surgery at the University of Toledo College of Medicine. He is the Academic Chief of Surgery for ProMedica and serves as Surgery Service Chief, ProMedica Physicians. He is deeply involved in educating medical students and residents through hands-on surgery experiences and bedside teaching. He serves as a mentor for them throughout their education and training. He is a recipient of the Deanâ€™s Award for Teaching Excellence 2014. He conducts clinical outcomes research.

Dr. Sferra is a practicing board-certified general surgeon with special interests in endocrine surgery, gastrointestinal surgery, surgical oncology, and complex problems in general surgery. Dr. Sferra is a Fellow in the American College of Surgeons (ACS). He has served as President, Ohio Chapter, ACS, and Governor, ACS 2006-2012. Prior to taking on his roles at ProMedica, he served as managing partner of a 17-surgeon group.

content.biography:
Mujeeb Sheikh, MD is a cardiologist. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions. He has extensive experience in the diagnosis and treatment of a wide variety of cardiovascular disorders with highly specialized invasive procedures.

Dr. Sheikh is board-certified in cardiology, interventional cardiology and internal medicine.

Care philosophy: He believes in delivering excellent care to his patients with respect, empathy and professionalism.

Conditions treated: Coronary artery disease, chronically blocked coronary arteries, hyperlipidemia, and peripheral vascular disease.

Procedures performed: Coronary stent procedure/angioplasty, complex coronary stent procedures including high risk cases using hemodynamic support devices, and complex coronary procedures including angioplasty of chronically blocked arteries of heart.

More about me: Dr. Sheikh settled in Toledo to raise his family after finishing his residency and fellowship at the University of Toledo.

He is an academician and researcher that has served as site investigator for many National Institutes of Health (NIH) sponsored clinical trials including GLAGOV study 2016 and ongoing MINT trial.

content.name: Mary Shenouda MD
content.language: American Sign Language, Arabic, English, Spanish
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Mary Shenouda, MD believes that all of us are on a special journey in this lifetime where we serve an important purpose in a perfectly weaved master plan. She is so thankful for the honor and grace that God has given her to take care of your eyes. She prays that His hands guide her hands and that His thoughts guide her thoughts so that she can provide you with excellent medical and surgical care.

Dr. Shenouda was the first surgeon in her region to perform Laser-Assisted Cataract Surgery. She is board certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology and is an active member of the American Academy of Ophthalmology, the Ohio State Medical Association, and the Ohio Ophthalmologic Society.

Awarded the Melvin Jones award by Lions Club International Foundation, Dr. Shenouda has been a Lion with Lima Host Lions Club since 2008. During her presidency, she was instrumental in funding and collaborating to establish the Goodwill Easter Seals Vision Center for the Visually Impaired in Lima, Ohio. Dr. Shenouda currently serve as Trustee of the Ohio Lions Eye Research Foundation, which for over 60 years, has been supporting research on numerous eye diseases at a variety of Ohio Institutions.

content.biography:
Henry Silverman III, MD is a cardiologist. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Dr. Silverman is board-certified in cardiovascular diseases and internal medicine.

Care philosophy: He believes in treating each patient with great respect and intellectual honesty. He also believes in basing his recommendations on evidence/data whenever possible while taking each patient's individual situation, other medical issues, and preferences into account.

Conditions treated: Cardiovascular diseases and rhythm disturbances, congenital heart disease, preventative cardiology, and follow-up care.

Procedures/treatments performed: Non-invasive procedures (echocardiograms, nuclear cardiac imaging studies with exercise testing or chemical/pharmacologic stress testing, plain treadmill stress testing, and stress echo cardiograms either on treadmill or chemical/pharmacologic), Holter and event monitors and resting EKGs, diagnostic cardiac catheterizations, elective cardioversions, 3D echocardiograms and myocardial strain measurements.

More about me: Toledo, Ohio is Dr. Silverman's hometown and where he practiced cardiology from 1981 till 2004. He then joined ProMedica in Adrian, Michigan where he sees patients in the office regularly. He also performs cardiology consults in the hospital exclusively at ProMedica Charles and Virginia Hickman Hospital in Lenawee, Michigan.

Dr. Silverman has served on the Alumni Board of Governors for the Ohio State College of Medicine for the last several years. He is also a die-hard Buckeyes fan. Both he and his father attended Ohio State University Medical School and Dr. Silverman was 6 years old when he attended his father's graduation. Dr. Silverman says his father was an outstanding family practitioner in Toledo and was a great influence on him. He says he is blessed to have had him as his father and mentor.

Her love for the birth process began at a young age, hearing her mother who had nine deliveries herself, tell each child their birth story at every birthday.

Her care philosophy is to treat patients the way she would her own family member, and to always listen with purpose. She is passionate about providing obstetrics and gynecologic care to patients of all ages, in all different aspects of life, and she has a strong clinical interest in making the labor process as patient centered as possible. Millie is excited to have returned to Toledo to serve the community she grew up in.

content.biography:
Jobst Vascular Institute is a world-renown vascular center that provides patients access to comprehensive vascular services including: vascular testing, vascular rehabilitation, wound care, anticoagulation care, clinical trials, and specialized treatment for varicose and spider veins.

The physicians of ProMedica Physicians Jobst Vascular and Jobst Vascular Institute all are board certified in vascular disease. With 15 office locations across northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan, we are committed to providing our patients and their families with high quality, innovative, and patient-centered care. 

Richard Simman, MD, FACS, FACCWS, recently joined Monroeâ€™s medical community after providing comprehensive plastic and reconstructive surgery in Dayton, Ohio, for 14 years. During his career, he has performed thousands of cases in both aesthetic and trauma surgery. He has additional expertise in head and neck surgery, surgical treatment of skin malignancies, and management and reconstruction of complex wounds.

Dr. Simman's skill and special interest in education and research led to his clinical professorship of plastic and reconstructive surgery, surgical dermatology, pharmacology and toxicology at Wright State University Boonshoft School of Medicine.

content.biography:
Kerri Simo, MD is the regionâ€™s first fellowship-trained hepatopancreatobiliary (HPB) surgeon. HPB surgery is a surgical specialty dedicated to the diagnosis and surgical treatment of both malignant and benign diseases of the liver, pancreas and gallbladder. She also has additional fellowship training in liver and kidney transplant as well as liver, biliary and pancreas surgery.

Dr. Simoâ€™s clinical interest include minimally invasive liver and pancreas surgery, microwave ablation and irreversible electroporation. She is involved on a national and international level to expand the adaptation of laparoscopic and robotic liver surgery as well as clinical trials to advance the surgical treatment of liver and pancreas cancers. Within her first year of practice here at ProMedica she established and continues to run a support group for post-Whipple patients.

Dr. Simoâ€™s hobbies include reading and running ultramarathons.

content.biography:
Robin Smale, MD is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN).

Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.

Care philosophy: Dr. Smale believes so much of our health is preventative and up to the individual. She believes patients control so much of their own health. She wants to encourage women to take control of their health and follow preventative and evidence-based medicine standards. Her hope is for all women to have a safe place to be treated for the problems that they develop throughout their life.

Special awards/certifications: AOA Honor Medical Society, ProMedica Philanthropy Award

More about me: Dr. Smale is a local girl. She was born and educated in the area and is proud to continue to practice in this area. She has always liked to work with her hands and enjoys gardening, minor home remodeling and crafts. She also enjoys hiking, biking and kayaking in the great outdoors.

content.biography:
Nasser Smiley, MD, FACC, is a cardiac electrophysiologist. Cardiac electrophysiology is a field within cardiology that specializes in heart conditions that cause arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation. The specialty also encompasses heart rhythm disorders that require pacemakers and defibrillators.

Dr. Smiley is board-certified in cardiovascular disease and internal medicine.

content.biography:
Steven Smolinski, MD is an obstetrician / gynecologist (OB-GYN).

Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born.

Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.

Dr. Smolinski enjoys guiding women and couples through their pregnancies, and feels it is a thrill and an honor to be able to bring new life into the world. He is experienced in minimally invasive surgery, which allows for quicker recovery times and less pain.

Care philosophy: It is important to Dr. Smolinski that when patients leave his office that they feel they have been listened to and that they understand what is going to be done and why.

Clinical interests: Family planning, cervical cancer screening and menstrual issues.

Joel enjoys many aspects and specialties of the medical world, with increased interests in menâ€™s health, infectious diseases, and psychiatric care. He believes preventive medicine is very helpful to try to find something before it becomes a problem later.

Joel tries be as unbiased as he can and solve any problems in an efficient and timely manner. He thinks it is important to have honest discussions with his patients, which is sometimes very hard and delicate but it only benefits everyone involved.

He is married with two little girls and enjoys spending time with them, telling dad jokes, fun trivia or little know trivia facts.

content.biography:
A. Vincent Songco, MD, FACC, FSCAI is an adult interventional cardiologist. He specializes in the diagnosis and treatment of cardiovascular disease in adults as well as in treating blocked arteries with stents.

He is board certified in adult cardiovascular disease, interventional cardiology, adult echocardiography and nuclear cardiology.

Care philosophy: Dr. Songco believes in actively engaging patients in their care so they have a clear understanding of their diagnosis and treatment plan as well as ways to work on prevention of future cardiac events.

More about me: He grew up in Monroe, Michigan where his father was a family physician for over 30 years. He attended Albion College where he met his wife. Dr. Songco completed his residency and fellowship training in Indianapolis, Indiana, and New York City, but moved back to Monroe to be close to family. He is happy to be living in Monroe and raising our two children here.

content.biography:
Dagmar T. Stein MD, PhD is a pediatric hematologist/oncologist. Pediatric Hematology / Oncology is a medical specialization in the diagnosis and treatment of both blood diseases (hematology) and cancers (oncology) in children. She has a PhD in tumor immunology

Care philosophy: Dr. Stein believes in a comprehensive team approach to support her patients through chronic illness. This team includes the patient, their parents/guardians, nursing staff, social workers, and additional specialists needed for optimal care. Communication with the patient and other care providers is important. 

She participates in the bi-weekly ProMedica Cancer Institute multidisciplinary clinical care conference.

Conditions treated: Bleeding and clotting disorders, blood disorders (anemia, thrombocytopenia, neutropenia), platelet function defects and menorrhagia.

Procedures performed: Bone marrow, spinal tap

Awards: 
  • Toledo Childrenâ€™s Hospital Fellow Medal, 2009
  • Northwest Ohio Hemophilia Foundation Family Service Award, 2002

More about Dr. Stein: She is married and has three grown children and one grandchild. Dr. Stein is originally from Pennsylvania, but has lived in Toledo since 1996. Her hobby is making jewelry.

content.biography:
It is estimated 5-10% of all cancers are due to underlying hereditary causes. When we identify a person that has a hereditary predisposition to develop specific cancers, it allows for medical management tailored to that personâ€™s individual risks. It may allow for additional treatment options for oneâ€™s cancer. It is also information that can be shared with family members as they may benefit from genetic counseling and possible testing. As a Genetic Counselor, we are uniquely trained to help families understand this information and work closely with their providers to ensure theyâ€™re receiving the best possible follow-up and screening.

Many people have questions about the genetic counseling and genetic testing process. If you feel that you would benefit from speaking with a healthcare professional about your personal or family history of cancer, Taylor encourages you to schedule an appointment with a genetic counselor. She looks forward to answering your questions and providing education about genetic testing.

content.biography:
Crawford J. Strunk, MD (Director of Sickle Cell treatment at ProMedica) is a pediatric hematologist/oncologist. Pediatric Hematology / Oncology is a medical specialization in the diagnosis and treatment of both blood diseases (hematology) and cancers (oncology) in children.

Care philosophy: I believe in patient-centered, family oriented care. I meet each patient where they are in their understanding of the disease. I try to explain current treatment recommendations and goals of therapy in as straightforward a manner as possible, allowing patients and families to take ownership of their own health.

Conditions treated: Sickle Cell disease, benign hematology, solid tumors, hemophilia, leukemia, lymphoma, and additional bleeding disorders.

Procedures performed: Bone marrow aspirate and biopsy, lumbar puncture (spinal tap).

More about me: I grew up in Pittsburgh and went to college at Colby, a small liberal arts college in Waterville, Maine. After fellowship at Rainbow Babies and Childrenâ€™s Hospital in Cleveland, we moved to Toledo to stay close to family. I am a football and hockey fan, cheering for the Steelers and Penguins. I am married and have three children.

After extensive training in Chicago, Kylie moved to Northwest Ohio and practiced acupuncture in a medical office providing supportive therapies to cancer patients. content.biography:
Alesha Switzer is a certified family nurse practitioner with 13 years of healthcare experience. She was a registered nurse at ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital and floated between many different departments including labor and delivery, emergency, intensive care, mental health, and pre/post op. 

Alesha also worked with a renowned endocrinologist in Knoxville, Tennessee, where she developed a passion caring for patients with thyroid issues. "The most important thing to me is working WITH patients, and staying open-minded to their unique needs, experiences, and ideas. Healthcare should be a partnership, and patients should be empowered to take control of their health and well-being." Alesha also believes that healthcare should be holistic. "Health is not only physical. Mental, spiritual, emotional, social, and physical health must all be addressed to provide the highest quality of care." 

Alesha lives in Napoleon with her husband and two sons. 

Family practice is appropriate for patients from birth through all stages of the life cycle, and addresses such needs as chronic illness, women's health, wellness exams, sports physicals and same day sick calls. Alesha is accepting new patients and is in the office Monday - Thursday.

title: Michael Tilson MD - Family Medicine - Monroe, Michigan (MI)

content.name: Michael Tilson MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Michael Tilson, MD specializes in family medicine. Family medicine is a primary care specialty that provides comprehensive care for both children and adults.

Dr. Tilson promotes education and discussion with his patients at each visit in order to ensure that everyone fully understands their chronic medical conditions so that they can be an active, informed participant in their treatment decisions and overall health. He will always promote modern evidence-based medicine and screening guidelines, and stresses the importance of preventive medicine over reactive medicine, since early detection can save lives. Dr. Tilson is motivated daily by the belief that by working to keep his patients at their healthiest, the community around us grows stronger.

During his medical school clinical rotations, Dr. Tilson had the opportunity to live in several large cities from Chicago to Baltimore to Atlanta (and several in between), where he had the opportunity to train at renowned institutions under leaders in their respective fields. He enjoyed every specialty and chose to pursue family medicine so that he could continue to experience all of the different fields of medicine within the office setting on any given day. Dr. Tilson completed his family medicine residency in Youngstown, Ohio, where he served as Chief Resident in his final year of training. Through his journey, he has learned how to practice highly effective medicine with the available resources, while caring for individuals from all different backgrounds and socioeconomic statuses.

Dr. Tilson was born and raised in southeast Michigan and enjoys all of the seasons and natural beauty that the state offers. He enjoys watching and participating in several sports, as well as staying active with outdoor activities such as hiking and boating. Dr. Tilson enjoys traveling and learning about new cultures and languages.

Orthopedic surgery is a specialty that focuses on the musculoskeletal system in regards to traumatic injuries, arthritis, and many other conditions. It focuses on treatment of bones, joints, ligaments, tendons, and other soft tissue structures.

Stephen Tisdale, PA-C state that his philosophy of care is to improve the health and well being of all of his patients by providing honest, respectful, and competent care.

As a former radiologic technologist, Stephen has always had a strong interest in diagnostic imaging. As a PA of orthopedic surgery, his role includes the ordering and independent interpretation of x-rays, CT scans, MRIs, ultrasound, bone scans, and other imaging modalities in collaboration with an orthopedic surgeon.

Although he specializes in orthopedic surgery and has worked as a orthopedic PA for many years, Stephen's didactic and clinical training in PA school provided him a strong knowledge base in primary care which facilitates my ability to provide comprehensive education for his patients.

content.biography: Albert Tsang, MD, FACS is a board certified general surgeon who is dedicated to the practice of surgery. He is fellowship trained in minimally invasive surgery and advance laparoscopy. Although Dr. Tsang practices the full spectrum of general surgery, he takes special interest in the treatment of reflux, hiatal hernias, and paraesophageal hernias. He has performed over 1200 laparoscopic hiatal hernia repairs and fundoplications. Additionally, he is the only surgeon in the region to perform the laparoscopic LINX magnetic sphincter augmentation for the treatment of reflux. Since 2013, he was an early user of the Intuitive Surgical daVinci robotic surgical platform. Dr. Tsang tailors the treatment to the patientâ€™s wants, needs, and desires. He is well versed in the use of traditional open procedures, laparoscopic, or robotic modalities to treat your condition.

content.biography:
Jackie Van Zile, MA, LPC, earned her Master of Arts degree from the University of Toledo and has worked in the mental health field for the past 7 years. She is a Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC) and has experience with both adults and young adults providing individual, couples, substance abuse, and group counseling in both inpatient and outpatient settings. She has worked with first responders, healthcare professionals, medical students, and persons in recovery from substance abuse.


Jackie is passionate about helping others understand and learn how to cope with anxiety, depression, trauma, life stressors, and dual diagnosis issues. She approaches treatment from a person-centered approach and encourages individuals to consider the influence of their physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual health on their overall health and well-being. She uses strength based, cognitive behavioral, motivational interviewing, solution-focused and mindfulness/grounding techniques to help empower individuals to reach their goals and achieve a sense of balance and wellness in their lives.


Jackie currently serves as the Education Chair and Board Member for the Employee Assistance Professional Association (EAPA) of Greater Toledo. She also serves as Secretary for a local non-profit supporting youth in the community.

content.biography:
Jackie Vannuyen, MD is an obstetrician/gynecologist (OB-GYN).

Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born.

Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.

More about me: I chose obstetrics and gynecology because of the wide variety within the narrow focus of womenâ€™s health. I care for women throughout their lifetime. I can educate, counsel and help women in the office setting. I become part of their family story when caring for them during pregnancy and delivery and I get to share in one of lifeâ€™s happiest moments. I also find it rewarding to perform surgery, using the latest minimally invasive techniques and treatments to achieve the best outcomes for my patients. 

Care philosophy: I believe that every person should be an active participant in their health. My job is to help prevent and identify health problems then explain all the possible risks, benefits, and alternatives of treatment options. Then we can work together to decide what treatment is best for them.

content.biography:
As an orthopaedic surgeon, the field of adult reconstruction, or hip and knee replacement surgery, allows Tyler Vovos, MD to utilize his engineering and mechanical background to help patients quickly and effectively improve their quality of life.

Dr. Vovos's care philosophy is based on treating patients as if they were a member of his family. Along these lines, he believes every medical decision a patient makes should be a shared one with their physician. Educating patients about all possible non-surgical and surgical options, as well as the risks and benefits of each is important Dr. Vovos. He then engages patients in a meaningful discussion about what the best treatment course for them is. His number one piece of advice for patients is to ask questions. When you are visiting Dr. Vovos, or any other orthopaedic provider, bring these questions with you.

Dr. Vovos has completed extensive training in total knee replacement, partial knee replacement, anterior and posterior total hip replacement, robotic hip and knee replacement, as well as revision (or re-do) hip and knee replacement surgery. He takes pride and passion in helping you and your loved ones in improving quality of life in the most effective and safest way possible.

content.biography:
Tanya Watson, DO is a doctor of osteopathic medicine specializing in obstetrics / gynecology.

Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.

Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born.

content.biography:
ProMedica Ear, Nose and Throat, the largest otolaryngology practice in northwest Ohio, provides comprehensive management of disorders involving the ears, nose and throat and other related structures of the head and neck region. Additionally, our physician-led team includes advance practice providers, audiologists and speech therapists. Our priority is to provide patient-centered care that is entirely focused on improving your health and well-being. We provide medical and surgical treatments for a wide range of conditions. Our approach to patient-centered care is what makes the ProMedica ENT patient experience unique.

Dr. Werning is a fellowship-trained head and neck cancer surgeon with more than 20 years of experience in the management of benign and cancerous tumors of the head and neck. He uses his advanced training in cancer surgery, facial plastic and reconstructive surgery, and dentistry to provide patients with the highest level of cutting edge health care. Dr. Werning strives to provide patient-centered care that focuses on the unique needs of every patient so that they experience the best possible outcomes and improved quality of life.

Learn more about ear, nose and throat care at ProMedica

content.biography:
Carl Westphal, OD has been practicing optometry for over 16 years. Optometrists are primary eye care physicians. They diagnose and treat a wide spectrum of eye conditions and can refer patients to specialists when more intensive treated is needed. 

Dr. Westphal has particular interest in contact lenses, general ocular pathology, and surgical co-management. He sees patients as young as 2 years old and adult patient. Dr. Westphal believes that the most important aspect of patient care is communication. Only when a patient is given thorough and concise information and included in the decision making process, can the proper treatment be executed. 

Dr. Westphal has lived in Northwest Ohio for 10 years with his wife and 7 children. He is been active in the community through church, Scouting BSA, and other organizations. He is dedicated to continue to service to the Toledo area.
