content.biography:
It is estimated 5-10% of all cancers are due to underlying hereditary causes. When we identify a person that has a hereditary predisposition to develop specific cancers, it allows for medical management tailored to that personâ€™s individual risks. It may allow for additional treatment options for oneâ€™s cancer. It is also information that can be shared with family members as they may benefit from genetic counseling and possible testing. As a Genetic Counselor, we are uniquely trained to help families understand this information and work closely with their providers to ensure theyâ€™re receiving the best possible follow-up and screening.

Lindsay appreciates many people may be unsure about the genetic counseling and genetic testing process. If you have questions, she encourages you to have an initial consult with a genetic counselor so we may address your questions and educate you regarding the options of genetic testing. Lindsay looks forward to talking with you.
education:
Masters in Genetic Counseling
University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, Michigan

content.biography:
Heather Wilson, CNM is a certified nurse-midwife.

Midwives are trained professionals who provide reproductive primary care and who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions.

Care philosophy: Heather strives to treat every woman the way she would want her own daughter treated. She believes in patient autonomy and shared decision making.

More about me: Heather enjoys working with diverse clientele including transgender and LGBTQ patients. She is skilled in the assessment, placement and management of pessary devices. She has been a CNM since 2009, is a mother of three adult children and is a 5th degree black belt in Shotokan karate. She likes to lift weights, ride bikes, kayak and is highly motivated to help her patients live a healthier life.

content.biography:
Stephanie Younes, MD, FACC, FSCAI, is an interventional cardiologist. Interventional cardiology is a subspecialty of cardiology that focuses on treating cardiovascular disease through catheter-based treatments.

Dr. Younes is board-certified in interventional cardiology, general cardiology, and internal medicine. 

Care philosophy: Dr. Younes believes in improving the quality of life for patients with cardiac disease by using a comprehensive team approach. 

Special interests: Coronary artery disease, mechanical circulatory support, rheumatic heart disease, Aortic stenosis, mitral valve disease, hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HOCM), cardiac pseudoaneurysms, coronary artery fistulas, structural heart disease, cardiac masses, percutaneous removal of endocarditis, atrial and ventricular septal defect, patent foramen ovale (PFO), stroke prevention for left atrial appendage occlusion, cryptogenic stroke, Chronic thromboembolic pulmonary hypertension (CTEPH)

Procedures performed: Alcohol septal ablation for hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, complex coronary interventions, deep vein thrombosis thrombectomy, invasive hemodynamics, left atrial appendage occlusion, patent Forman Ovale (PFO) and atrial septal defect (ASD) closure, percutaneous cardiac pseudoaneurysm closure, percutaneous coronary fistula closure, percutaneous Mechanical circulatory support, percutaneous minimally invasive valvular repair and/or replacement of severe aortic mitral and tricuspid valvular pathologies (TAVR, TMVr, mitral clip), percutaneous minimally invasive valvular replacement of degenerated surgical valves (valve in valve procedures), percutaneous mitral valvuloplasty for rheumatic mitral stenosis, percutaneous paravalvular leak closure, percutaneous removal of cardiac masses including endocarditis and thrombus in transit, and pulmonary artery balloon dilations for chronic thromboembolic pulmonary hypertension (CTEPH).

title: Mark Zekaj MD - Orthopaedic Surgery - Monroe, Michigan (MI)

content.name: Mark Zekaj MD
content.location: ProMedica Physicians Orthopaedic Surgery - Monroe St.
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Physicians Orthopaedic Surgery - Monroe St.

content.biography:
Mark Zekaj, MD is fellowship trained in adult hip and knee reconstruction surgery with a focus on treatment of osteoarthritis of the hip and knee as well as revision surgery following total hip and knee replacement. His clinical interests include complex primary osteoarthritis treatment, robotic surgery, minimally invasive surgical approaches, revision total hip and knee replacement. Dr. Zekaj's care philosophy is to provide the highest standard of care to his patients using evidence based practice guidelines.

Dr. Zekaj was born in Detroit and grew up in Southfield, Michigan. He is happy to be back in Michigan to provide orthopedic care to the community.

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center

content.biography: Amelia has been with the ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Childrenâ€™s Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center since it opened in 2012. She began with the program as a 1:1 behavior technician where she directly implemented programming based on the principles of applied behavior analysis. Amelia received her certification as a Board Certified Behavior Analyst in 2015 and a Certified Ohio Behavior Analyst in 2016 and has been a Behavior Analyst at the Finnegan Family Autism Center since 2018. She is passionate about providing individualized intervention to all children on her caseload and providing them with the opportunity to grow and succeed. In her free time, Amelia enjoys reading and is an avid sports fan. She especially loves spending time with her family, husband, young daughter, and puppy.

title: David Sell PA-C - Neurosurgery - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: David Sell PA-C

primaryLocation.locationAddress:
2130 W. Central Ave.
Suite 105
Toledo, OH 43606

content.biography:
I grew up in a rural community in eastern Ohio but moved to Toledo for my undergraduate degree in 1996.  I chose to stay in Toledo for graduate school and have worked in brain and spine surgery all but one year of my career.  I love the challenge that Neurosurgery offers and cannot imagine working in a different specialty.  I chose to treat my patients the way that I would like to be treated and believe this helps in making personal connections and fostering trust.  

Navigating the health care system can be intimidating and overwhelming, therefore I try to make the experience more pleasant for my patients. Clinically, I am interested in Normal Pressure Hydrocephalus (NPH), Cervical myelopathy, Craniosynostosis, Brain tumors, Lumbar fusion and Revision Lumbar fusion (PLIF/TLIF).  I am trained in pedicle screw placement and fixation as well as Normal Pressure Hydrocephalus (NPH).
education:
Master of Science/Biomedical Science
Medical College of Ohio, Toledo, Ohio
